review_body: We loved Hotel East 21 Tokyo! Nightly price was very affordable, the amenities offered in the room was probably the best I've had for the price we paid. The room was always nice and tidy, and they always ended up refilling our shampoo/conditioner/body wash-- which was nice because in the U.S., you usually only just get that one travel size bottle. Some reviews complained that the hotel was too far from a metro station, but the walk really wasn't that bad. A big plus was that it was minutes away from a 711 and also inside a plaza. The staff was welcoming and accommodating. We were a party of 2 so we booked the small double room and I do want to point out that the space is very cozy but sufficient. Our room was also nice to have a city view of Tokyo. The hotel also offers shuttles to/from the airport and to/from Disney Sea/Disneyland for a fee, which was super convenient.

Location about 10 minute walk to the nearest metro. But lots of eateries nearby, even a supermarket nearby. They provide free shuttle to disney resort and paid shuttle to skytower and odaiba. Staff provided excellent serviceOverall, would stay here again.

Hotel was lovely, good location with easy access to the subway just a short walk away. However there is a free courtesy bus to the subway they have an airport limo service and there is a bus that takes you straight to Sky Tree for a very small cost. Staff are all friendly and helpful and I was surprised how large the room was compared to other hotels. The best bit was the view from our window, stunning. Nothing was too much trouble and will definitely stay again

The staff at this property are amazing, service for my 2 night stay was outstanding. The room was a fair size for a single room. The breakfast was excellent! The WiFi was superb. Why I am not rating it 5? The location is a bit out but the train station is near enough. The gym is an additional payment and I think this should be included in a hotel stay and finally, only one English tv station which is CNN! In my view a hotel catering for international tourists should have a bit more than this on their television line up!

The first day in Japan, our 4 days Tokyo with this property was very comfortable from check in to check out, very stylish hotel but except room every other amenities are changeable, however, we were not looking for the same as once we leave hotel returns only by evening, the nearest metro/subway is around 1 kM.The hotel provides free drop off facility on regular interval but till 12 Noon for Metro/subway station.very convenient in term of big supermarket lots of food options (Not for vegetarian) within the property premises.

it is a great hotel I stayed there for 6 days with my friend a bus picked me up from the airport and brought me to the magnificent hotel it has an indoor pool and outdoor pool it also has a spa, this first impression of Tokyo would make me want to go to Tokyo again

My family and I stayed at this hotel as part of an airfare+hotel package. The per night cost of the hotel turned out to be a little over 100 USD a night. This is very affordable for a four-star hotel in Tokyo. The nearest subway station takes you straight to downtown, in about 10 minutes, and is about a 10-minute walk from the hotel. The neighborhood looks quiet but it surprisingly is teeming with a lot of office workers during rush hours. The hotel offers complimentary transfers to the subway station at set times. The hotel itself reminds one of the big urban hotels of the 1990s. Not to worry though, everything is kept spic and span. The hallways always had a faint smell of fragrance, which is perfect. The rooms are made up daily with nothing left untouched (even brochures which had been lying about had been stacked in order). There are a lot of in-room amenities, including a fabric freshener. Most 5-star hotels don't even have the same amount and variety of amenities. If I have to think of a downside, it would be the modest size of the standard rooms (higher categories seem to be on par with hotels of the same class), but such is the norm in Japan.

Not really located around any attractions but close to subway and I walked to Skytree other places (about an hour I think). Room was clean. Breakfast was good. Service was excellent except for not letting me check in early - I had not pre-booked that so not their fault and they sent my bag up when the room was ready).. Overall would recommend as an option but Tokyo is so big that you may want to plan your hotel based on what you want to do. That being said, close subway made things fairly easy and I would go back here.

Pros Nice staff. The waitress and bar staff who served us in the 21st floor bar were excellent. Lots of staff on hand. Good bathroom size. Not the smallest room I have had in Tokyo. Free bus service to station was helpful. ConsFeels a bit out of the way for exploring Tokyo. The hotel is not kidding when it advertises a “small double”. Smallest double bed I have ever slept in. Breakfast was not the standard I gave come to expect from Japanese hotels. Very standard food and almost no change in offering across the week.

The hotel is in Koto-ku, 20 min by subway from Tokyo. You need to walk 15 minutes to the Toyocho station though. The hotel is well maintained, rooms are clean, well lit, bigger than usual room size for Tokyo. Big windows with a view of the city. Room has amenities, kettle, coffee, tea, fridge. Good wifi coverage. Bathroom is clean, with amenities, hair drier.Bed is comfy, all comfortable. Ironing board you can borrow. The hotel has restaurants but you can go around for eating as there is a small commercial center just downstairs with restaurants, cafes and supermarket, very convenient. If you go to Tokyo, maybe the only thing would be walking for 15 min (dragging a heavy bag maybe tough) to the subway station or if you decide to take a bus(challenging for foreigners). There is a bus to the airport and they have shuttle service to the subway station but early in the morning...they have a shuttle bus also for Tokyo Disneyland for the ones interested. The staff is very attentive too, so a nice stay. I recommend.

We stayed there with my teenage son for 2 nights and at check-in the employee although seeing we got there on foot did not bother to mention that they offered a free shuttle service to the closest metro station (a 12 min walk, that can be unpleasant in the heat when dragging a suitcase) . We learned of it the day of our departure which happened to be the day after typhoon Kazai and public transportation was quite disturbed. Luckily the concierge had reliable info on the metro network status. Still at check-in the employee did not bother to tell us much, maybe because of his poor english (I don’t blame him though but her mgmt). So we also found out by chance that the hotel was on the route of a semi-express bus to Tokyo Skytree and Odaiba, and that the fare could be paid with regular transport cards (e.g Suica) ... these are 2 major attractions that we visited on our own.Lastly the surcharge to access the garden pool: over 30 euros pp on week days and over 55 euros pp on weekends is simply a rip-off considering the room rate! I would not recommend it and certainly won’t go back

Rooms are big enough and the view from the room was lovely. There are lots of restaurant and the staffs are really nice and kind. Food was lovely. My wife and I enjoyed our time. Best place in tokyo Recommend to anyone.

The rooms are big with nice views, it is very clean and its location is very good with plenty of restaurants and supermarkets around the area.Lovely staff.The nearest tube station is 8 minutes walk and there is a free minibus from the hotel to the station

First I would give 3 but communication takes to a 2, this is so important esp when they site english speaking staff. Website says they have English speaking staff, that is NOT correct. This is 3rd hotel so far in our 3 week trip. This is the 1st hotel we have had communication issues. This has been the most expensive and least accomodating.They charge extra for everything! The room is large,but that is all.The bed has a bottom sheet and a down coverlet that is it with a pillow.If you have to call down stairs or try to talk with anyone at pool spa area you can forget it. I had a translator on my phone and despite that the young lady cocked her head and just kept repeating the same statement, finally i gave up and walked away. Yes it has a kettle, but no tea or coffee bags, yes there is a shuttle to airport, but there is a charge $30 head, Yes there is a pool but that cost for a family of 3 to use ONLY outside pool $ 190.00 for ONE day during week.I would NOT stay here again. Too many other options focused on customer satisfaction.

ConsYou have to pay extra to watch TV, and I mean just to watch TV, nothing special, never seen this option before. This payment is Daily.You have to pay extra to use the pool, and being a family this charge can be even more expensive than the room itself. I'm talking about week days, because during the weekends the price is even higher!!!!Of course breakfast is additional as well. Is not a nice buffet, just a continental option..Closest metro station (Toyocho) is about 15 minutes walk, not a big deal unless is summer time...these 15 minutes were hell every day..ProsThe hotel is part of small mall/restaurants area, it means just taking the elevator takes you to a good supermarket, drugstore, bakery or restaurant, where you can actually have a good breakfast/meal.OthersThe rooms are small, I had to take 2 rooms to accommodate my familyThe area (once in the metro) is fairly distanced from nice areas like skytree, ginza & shibuya.

we arrived at the hotel yesterday and are here for two weeks, we were unaware of the additional pool fees which are charged daily no matter how long you wish to swim. It will cost my family around £80 a day extra if I wish to go for a dip in my pool on what is already a very expensive trip. At the weekend this is around £110. We intend to do lots of sight seeing of course so there is no option to go for an hour to unwind later. These are all import considerations. The only outdoor space to sit and unwind is the pool garden and you have to pay the fee. If you wish to sit in any lounge area in the hotel you must buy food or drink. There are a couple of seats in the lobby. The rooms are tiny and is the only place we can chill when wanting to rest from sight seeing so it is very claustrophobic for a family. I really would not recommend staying here. There seams to be no consideration for families at all.

This is a fine hotel with 600 m to the T-line subway, so what’s the problem? The room WiFi is so bad, that it is effectively out of order. We had the hotel “experts” looking at it twice, but they clearly did not have a clue. Breakfast is seriously overpriced, but there are plenty of alternatives in the complex, so no worries.

Very nice hotel and rooms. Breakfast was excellent, there is a variety for English, Chinese and Japanase cuisine. Staff is friendly and approachable. Stayed with friends and all enjoyed the stay. Very pleased with our choice.Regrettably, it’s not that convenience with heavy luggage, too far away from metro station.

I appreciate that this hotel doesn’t pretend to be something it’s not—it is not a new or luxury property, and it is priced accordingly. The rooms are very dated and not in the best condition, but certainly fine as you really aren’t paying for a luxury room. I asked for a quiet room on a high floor and was upgraded to a larger room, which was very much appreciated. The view was fantastic and the free wifi was decent. I would stay again.

Having only stayed in 3 star hotels up until this point, this really felt like being spoiled. Housekeeping seemed to go above and beyond for us. Everything was spotless upon returning each day. Some days even pyjamas were folded neatly on the bed. Very close to Toyocho station. Have shuttle buses to airport and station ad Disney resort. For a small fee of course. Lots of restaurants in the area. And grocery store was open until 10:00-11:00 most nights which was perfect. Definitely recommend.

Really pleased with the service we received from this hotel during our 10 day stay. Breakfast was of a very good quality (we didn't have any other meals here) and not as busy as we had been led to believe it might have been. I enjoyed my freshly-prepared omelette every morning! Staff, as has been said before, very polite and professional.Room was of a good size (on 16th floor) with 1 comfy chair and a hard chair (would have appreciated 2 comfy chairs!) - very convenient location just 6-7 mins from Toyocho subway station and 12-15 mins away from central Tokyo/Tokyo station. Would happily return when next in Tokyo (we were visiting our son) - not the cheapest, but in this case we got what we paid for.

I would have given the hotel high review score. It's big, clean, nice. Except, for a theft from my room. I fell asleep with my Kindle and it must have fallen between the sheets. Next morning I went on my business. Never saw the Kindle again, gone with many personal documents and being unlocked. I kept calling the hotel over the next 10 days since I am still in Japan. The Kindle was never found (see arched under the bed, etc.). Whoever did my room must have either tossed it away, or appropriated it. Either way, I can't believe this has happened in Japan. I have been coming here for over a decade, and lived here too.

As soon as we arrived we knew it was a wonderful hotel.Rooms elegantly furnished.Staff were amazing. So polite.So professional.A few minutes from Toyocho metro station that whisked us so quickly to anywhere we wanted to go..We were on the 19th floor which gave us stunning views of Tokyo especially Tokyo Sky TreeBreakfast was great.We would very happily return to this lovely hotel..No complaints

Santa Cruz de la Palma, Spain

review_body: East 21 is a very comfortable hotel in a great location, when I booked I asked for a view of the Skytree and was delighted when to find I'd been given one when I arrived !It is very close to the metro and provides transport which is handy if you have luggage. Lots of choice for breakfast, the staff were helpful and the single room was a good size, I would stay here again when in Tokyo

Hotel staff is very kind, breakfast is very good, regular room was too small I expect it to be cleaner but the most disappointing point when I went to the GYM they ask for extra cost per entry because its for members only. 7 min walk from the nearest metro station

It is nice and very clean hotel. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located close to disney and other attractions, restaurants etc. Hotel provides free transportation to many locations tourists would like to go eg train station, disney

Never heard of this hotel before, and been to Tokyo 3 or 4 times, always stayed at the Prince at the Minato due to the room size of the hotel and extra luxury for that that hotel. And Hotel East 21 at toyocho surprised me with the service from the staffs and roomy size of the room, walkable distance to the transport. Can’t go wrong with this little piece of luxury.

One of the reasons that I stay in this hotel was the easiness to go to and from Tokyo Disney Resort. They provide you with a shuttle bus, but you have to reserve via their website (it is free). The other thing was a shuttle bus from Narita Airport with a very reasonable cost, so you don't have to use the train to get here (they also provide you a shuttle bus to the nearest train station, isn't that great!). Room and services were excellent. Breakfast was outstanding, an outstanding and fresh selection of fish was available during the time I stay.

Stayed here for 10 days with my husband and 2 little kids in a twin-with-extra-bed room. The room is quite small for us. We had the pool view and the room was clean and bright. Bathroom is spacious and provides all the necessities required.Being a Disney good neighbor hotel, they provide free shuttle to Disneyland. Be sure to make reservation for this shuttle service to & fro once you have set your date to Disneyland as it could be fully-reserved with no available seats. They provide free shuttle to nearest train stations too. Anyway, we took our morning walk to Toyocho station everyday as it is less than 10mins walk away. We also took the paid shuttle to Odaiba which takes less than 20mins compared to taking train which would take longer. The hotel area has some restaurants and Lawson is just nearby. So this hotel is quite convenient. The only problem for us is that they do not have a laundromat within the hotel building. As ours is a long vacation trip, I already planned to do laundry and you can image how big is my jaw-drop when the hotel told me that they do not have a laundry in the hotel. Anyway, they took out a map and pointed us the way to the nearest laundromat. So my husband walked to the laundromat to do the laundry, carrying a big bag of clothes looking like santa-claus (we were there near Christmas by the way... hohoho...)Overall, I'm still quite happy with my stay here. Price is reasonable and location is convenient for eateries, convenience stores and train station.

Really friendly staff. Breakfast was avarage. Room was OK. A lot of furniture. Bed was really nice. We can see a couple of pools from our window. They are not opend now, but they look really nice. If they belong to the hotel it must be a great place in the summer. On 21 floor they have a skybar, a steakhouse and a Japanese Tapanyaki restaurant. Under the hotel is a quite big supermarket, a drugstore, a few shops and lots of restaurants. There is sushi, Italian, steakhouse, Burger King and Subway just to mention a few. Metro Subway is a 10 minutes walk. It is very easy to ride the subway. Really easy to buy tickets and to understand where to get off. They have really easy-understanding maps and timetables over busses and Subway and the surroundings of the hotel. Just ask the personal at the bag drop

the location- very good in a nice and pleasant neighborhood vicinity - very good, connected with the property various restaurants, convenience stores, supermarket, just cross the street and you have more 24hr convenience stores like lawsons, family mart etc rooms - spacious for Tokyo city and were clean and nice, well cleaned dailystaff- helpful and friendly english speaking stafftransport - airport buses from both Haneda and Narita , Disney parks buses FOC , buses to few local attractions , local trains/mrt stations nearby overall very nice place to stay in Tokyo

We recently stayed at this hotel and it's very easy to find and get around. There's plenty of nice inexpensive restaurants and convenience stores around, makings a pleasant location. Also a nice park next to hotel

I booked this hotel because there was a great deal for it via Agoda.com. This time I was travelling with my mom and husband, so we opted to go for a triple sharing room. Hotels in Japan are typically small so I knew space was going to be tight but I was surprised because the room was quite spacious even with 3 single beds. There was still space to move and store our luggage which is amazing!Hotel lobby looks grand and "expensive" which is why I prefer small hotels for their quaint, cozy spaces. We got a bit confused at first when we reached the hotel because apparently the lobby is not on the ground level, but it's one floor up the escalator which we didn't easily see at night.It has a lot of eating places below the hotel. They also have a close by Family Mart and Lawson.The only drawback is that it's not really close to a train station (10-15 mins walk). The hotel provides a free bus shuttle to the station but you have to wait. The hotel also has a shuttle to Disneyland.

Room was nice, but a bit smelly... facilities are nice, breakfast is overpriced ! The room was quite beautiful, unfortunately there was a strong smell, I think from the bathroom pipes.Breakfast id nearly $30 and I think it is overpriced, for what they have on offer. The breakfast buffet is big, but by far, nothing special that require such a price...Cheap cheese, and mostly cheap items. Good, but cheap. Some other hotel with a tag price like that for breakfast, will put some better cheese, and better juice... Staff is nice and helpful.

Perfect stay in a twin room en suite, staff are professional and helpful. Rooms are spacious with tv, fridge, kettle with a choice of teabags, cups and cutlery , air con, hairdryer and complimentary bottle of water. There is free wifi. The beds were very comfortable. Shisheido branded toiletries are available for use. The hotel also has a shuttle bus to the nearby tube station but it runs in the morning only. It's a first come first serve basis. However it's about 10 min walk up the street to the station which isn't too far. There is a bus transfer to Tokyo Disney resort and to the airports and to the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel if you want a comfortable stay and with good transport links to Disney and the airport.

Booked this hotel due to it having the free shuttle bus to Disneyland/Sea and was very pleased with the overall stay. The room size was big for two people, having views of the city and within the hotel views of the Tokyo skytree tower. There was plentiful daily supplies of amenities and the rooms kept clean, we also got free bottled water each day which was good for our travels. Only the carpets were a little dated but not a major problem. Staff were professional and helpful and we got by with English, although would have preferred if WE could have spoken more Japanese to them! There’s a morning free shuttle bus to the local train station Toyocho, but it’s a straight walk down the road of around 10mins or less. We used google maps to get around, not an issue for us to get to tourist attractions as the trains are very efficient.There’s also a very large supermarket and mini food court from the hotel which we used everyday, very covenient.For smokers, there’s a designated room in the hotel which is well air conditioned and clean.Overall we enjoyed our stay and would definitely book this hotel again!

Part of a tour of Japan. Convenient location. Near metro stations. Full facilities. Very supportive staff.Several restaurants and others within easy walk.Rooms relatively small but typical for Japanese hotel rooms

A decent business hotel, with many restaurants and shops in the same complex, offers good comfort and space.The over-friendliness of Japanese staffs makes one even slightly embarrassed by not knowing how to react.However, Gym and sauna are costing extra, 30 USD, the grill restaurant, rated by TripAdvisor as moderate priced, costs easily more than 100 USD each, an expensive gourmet experience for miniatures of food.

This is a pleasant hotel which has several pluses - swimming pools (although the outdoor one closes on 9 September) but you have to pay extra and good shopping - including a supermarket and a 100 Yen shop - and several popular cafes and restaurants. It's quiet and handy for activities on this side of Tokyo. The hotel's own Harmony restaurant is very good.

Well located. Rooms are oldish and no refreshed but clean. Wifi is working well. Breakfast at 3000 jpy is ... i let you see. Staff very friendly and helpfull. You are 7 min walk from metro station. Over all good value for money bur a but far from everything.

Very nice hotel very big very big room very big bathrooms lots of space to move around in compared to most Japanese hotels great proximity to Tokyo Disney and only 5 km from the Tokyo Sky Tree Hotel also has a little Mall attached to it from the bottom floor good places to shop and eat I really enjoyed my stay there would definitely stay there again I was just there September 14th

Came to Japan the first time with family. Staffs are very polite. When we first arrived, I asked for a room with a view to Skytree tower. He was not able to but he gave us our room on the 19th floor and we can see the Skytree tower when we go to the elevator. Room is clean but the carpet is old which I have expected since I had read past reviews. Disadvantage of the room is the bathroom, noticed some hair on the wall and when I wiped it with wet wipes it was black. Noticed mold in between the gap of wall. Door also had mold. No ventilation and door would not stay open. We thought it was a great location. Lots of convenient stores, supermarket and a lot of close by restaurants with only locals which we like. There was this one restaurant that we went to where there was no English menu but it was OK. We just pointed the photos of what we wanted to order. Overall a great hotel except for the bathroom. 4 of us travelling and each of us got our own bed. One being a sofa bed and one is a potable bed.

Stayed for a few nights at the East 21 for business. Booked in on the Friday evening and first impressions were not the greatest. Reception area is ok and the staff were helpful on checking in. The decor though looked a bit tired in the lifts, corridors and the room I was in. The bedroom was clean but just needs some time spent doing it up. The bed was comfy and the bathroom linen was always clean and fresh. The TV is limited to a few channels. One of the main plus points would seemed to be the link buses to take you to Disney. There is a voucher system for breakfast with both western and local foods available with a great variety of food on offer. The hotel is about a 10 minutes walk from the local tube station that gets you round the rest of Tokyo. As the hotel was for business it was ok but I don’t think I would stay there if I was travelling independently on holiday.

We stayed two nights in a four bed room.The good points:Comfortable bedsFantastic view of the Sky Tree from the room and the cocktail barLargish room, clean, (but a bit dated/in need of refurbishment)Impressive lobby and liftsGood breakfastEfficient front desk staff who spoke some EnglishMy oldest son and husband ate sushi in the Japanes restaurant and said that the food was goodThe cocktail bar does snacksThe not so good:I wasn't prepared to pay over 6000 yen to use the pool on a weekend, (a shame as it looked good on the pics and I had partly chosen the hotel because of the pool. I knew there was a charge, but didn't realise it was quite so much - my fault!)The bedroom hallways are very shabby - the carpet looks like something from a seedy 80s Bournemouth hotel I stayed in once upon a time!The staff in the cocktail bar were not very welcoming - I didn't get the impression that they were used to English visitorsIt's a good 10-15 minute walk to the subway, (hard in intense heat) - again, my fault - not the hotel's!I chose this hotel because I intended to go to Disney on one day and it offers a shuttle service. However, we changed our minds and its location wasn't good for sightseeing in Tokyo itself - again - that is obviously my fault - not the hotel's!We found the service from restaurant staff at breakfast, as well as that from the staff in the cocktail bar, somewhat off-hand. Quite a shock after the politeness we had experienced everywhere else. The front desk staff were helpful and welcoming, however.If the area suits you, then this hotel is perfectly ok and the breakfast, in particular, is worth having. Views of the Sky Tree are a definite bonus. It was a poor choice of area on my part for us, so I wouldn't choose to stay there again, (unless I was DEFINITELY going to Disney!)

Nice hotel with rooms that are a bit worn. Lobby area is nice. A medium sized area in the lobby has chairs and tables with cafe style table service and is open from 10am to 630pm. Buffet breakfast was good with many food and drink options. Plenty of Japanes fare. It takes about 35 to 45 minutes to get downtown on the metro (including walking to Toyoxho station). Was 95 deg F (32 deg C) while I was there. My room was comfortable for me but the air conditioner was probably maxed out. I'd definitely stay again.

If you are looking for a hotel that is not too expensive and with easy access to the trains, then this hotel will be good. It is situated just outside the city and walking distance to Toyocho train station.When you arrive, make sure you make reservations with the hotel conscierge for your limosine bus back to the airport. It gets taken up fast.The hotel breakfast has a fairly good spread. There are supermarkets within the hotel grounds if you need to get mineral water, etc.However, there are not many good restaurants in the vicinity. The hotel itself is good, with efficient staff. Just felt that the carpets could do with some cleaning.The TV channels are all in Japanese and movies are pay per view.Overall, a fairly good hotel.

What a joke of a hotel ! Run down building that needs updating .. A portable AC unit in the rooms with dirty floors . I was welcomed into my room with a big poo in the toilet !! They charge 45 per day to swim !!! Not advertised before you book this hotel !!! No tattoos aloud on premises !?!? Funny thing is even after seeing this review the Managment won't do anything still ... Do yourself a favor and find another place that doesn't have fecis in the toilet when you arrive This hotel doesn't even deserve 1 star !!!

Pros - location: nearby and at the hotel itself is a plaza including many restaurant and a supermarket that opens until 11pm.Walking to Toyocho station is not that far with 7 mins walk. In addition, u can walk to the park in 5 mins. - staffs are great in generalCons- room size is too small for 3 people room- air conditioning is poor and feeling humid and hot in the guest room- though the hotel is like a 4-Star ( convention / conference hotel ) the large space is not relevant to my stay- entire building and facilities are built back in early 90s which needs major renovation- swimming pool requires 4000 yen ! But the website did not mention- gym is small and old if you care

The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from Toyocho station on the Tozai line which can get you to many tourist destinations in Tokyo and Tokyo station. The room was quite nice, large with a good view, the WI-FI worked well. Didn't try the breakfast as it was very expensive but there are plenty of cheap eateries near the hotel. The main reason for choosing this hotel was the gym which turned out to be very disappointing-small with a very limited number of old machines. If you have tattoos-beware, regardless of their size you will be asked very persistently to cover them when going into the swimming pool. I have no idea as to what they are going to do about this rather ridiculous demand during the Tokyo Olympics in 2020.

The hotel old but very clean,the room is quite big for Japan. The location is great. There are lots of shop n restaurant near by.Service is good, the bus to Disneyland is a bonus. Will definatly stay here again!!!!

The hotel is five minutes away from the metro station and there are many interesting restaurants nearby. The staff was very helpful and the room was clean and big enough. We were able to leave our suitcases behind while we went to Kyoto which was very helpful. If arriving to Tokyo through Narita, you can take the Narita Express and then a taxi from Tokyo station (about $25).

Front desk was nice, ordinary for a larger hotel. Room was satisfactory given it had 4 singles. The room smelled old and soiled which was evident in the carpet. The mattresses were comfortable but the box springs had stains on the sides. The only plus - the water pressure from the shower head. Hotel restaurants are expensive and if you want to use the amenities, it's extra.

Great priced, included breakfast buffet or lunch menu set coupons. Good location near a few restaurants and a large local market to buy everything you need. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Staff spoke enough English to get by.

Ok Hotel if you don't spend too much time in it, with a bit of need of updating in the rooms, but functional and everything worked properly. When I visited in May the pool was closed and it was a big disappointment. My room was small and bathroom was small too. OK Wifi and shuttle service to the tube station (one way only) was a big plus. Good breakfastVery helpful staf

Too bad we only stayed here for 1 night... the hotel has great location, because we can find many restos so easily on ground floor, also a drugstore and a supermarket. all walking distance from hotel lobby.the room is not too small and not too spacious as well. just enough for us to sleep very comfortably. love the amenities.. breakfast was exquisit. i remember the grape they served during bfast. well done :)

I stayed at Hotel East 21 during May'18. Its a decent hotel however a bit far out from the city centre. You'll have to walk about 10mins from Toyocho station in order to get to the hotel. Because I went during May the pool was closed so I can't give you a review of the pool. Once you're at the hotel there are a multitude of amenities, shops and restaurants on ground floor level (Tully's coffee, hungry jacks, Japanese restaurants). There's even a supermarket where you can buy groceries and food to eat for a very affordable price (cooked yakitori, fruit, vegetables, sushi and bento).I think one of the best things about the hotel is value for money (rooms for <USD$100/Night). If you know your way around and don't mind a bit of trek from the city centre then this place is a little gem.Pros:Good amenities and shops close by.Very good value for money.Cons:A bit far from the city centre, ~30mins

Had a fantastic stay at Hotel East 21. Stayed for one night with my parents and my two young children. Booking request for a baby cot was met, and the cot was ready in the room when we arrived. Two single beds for my parents, one sofa-bed for me and my son. A nice, big room for us all with plenty of space for the children to play and explore. A great view across Tokyo from the window.Hotel was easy to find. A five minute walk from the Metro station. Supermarket, shops and restaurants by the base of the hotel too.Sleep quality was great. Nice comfy beds. A little bit of noise from the corridor, but nothing too bad.Breakfast was superb. Plenty of choice and tasty food. Good for young children too, with rice, cereal, yoghurt, fresh fruit and plenty of other choices.All in all, a really great stay. Would stay again, and would definitely recommend.

Checked in to this hotel during 1st visit to Tokyo. Room is spacious but faraway from train station, at least 15min walk and another 15min subway ride to central area. Buffet breakfast is good. There is a small shopping centre downstairs with a supermarket and a few restaurants. Plenty of convenience stores closeby too.

We were there just overnight so it was more than fine but wouldn't stay any longer. Room were very small and Smoky (even thought it was a non smoking floor). Service was fine.Breakfast buffet was average not bd to great.

Myself and 3 girlfriends stayed here for 2 or 3 nights, the service was amazing, breakfast was great and the room was nice! There were a few good places near buy to get a few groceries, eat dinner etc. We also went to DisneySea and a bus picked us up from right at the hotel. Would stay here again.

Good location about halfway between Haneda Airport and Tokyo Station. Lots of shops and restaurants around. We just stayed one night while transiting Tokyo. Rooms were fine but we were annoyed the gym was an additional $30 to use when we were already paying a pretty high price for our room.It seems like a lot of tour groups use this hotel, so there was a pretty long line waiting for breakfast in the morning and the elevators were slow because it seemed like everyone checked out at once.

Nice hotel, friendly staff, but a bit far from toyocho station. Free shuttle to station offered by hotel but very limited number of trips per day. A lot of restaurants nearby the hotel. A supermarket where you can buy cooked food and a microwave is ready available. A cosmetic store also around. So far not that bad for basic needs. Airport limousine bus will pick up up at the lobby but only 2x a day.

Economical hotel. I believe there is a free shuttle bus to Disney world from the hotel. there is also a cheap but tasty sushi restaurant at the first floor of the hotel.. a very nice hotel afterall!!!

This hotel is lovely, clean and the staff are friendly and helpful. The location is not quite as good as our other booking in Asakasa. The hotel is a bit far from the nearest station, you'll need a taxi to get luggage there. Our room face the Tokyo tower, which was a beautiful sight at night.Rooms are very small, but not atypical of Tokyo, where space is a premium.

Very beautiful and attractive hotel location.very delicious food being served.lots of food varities are placed in the buffet.very friendly staff service.hotel security is great. High technology being used in the hotel.

Hotel is located at Toyocho Station whereby there is a free shuttle provided during certain timing from the hotel. Alternatively, you may choose to walk. If your itinerary includes disneyland, shuttles are also available to and fro. Airport limousine is also available. Basically it is a hotel that offers all the convenience for guests. Room is decent and service is friendly. A supermarket, convenience store, pharmacy and dining options available nearby the hotel vicinity.

It's about 7minutes walk away from the Toyochyo station of the Metro Tozai line. Various restaurants and convenience stores within walking distance. Offers free shuttle buses to and from TDR everyday! (Only about 30minutes ride from the hotel.) Although Sky Tree was on the otherside, I still really enjoyed the beautiful night scenary of Tokyo from my room. Skyscrapers were glittering in the sky! Hotel staff are very polite and helpful, willing to make you feel comfortable. Not sure about their western food restaurant, but "Toh-En", the Chinese restaurant is superb!! Reservation is recommended, because it is usually very crowded.

ebilove
つくば市 Tukuba Japan

review_body: the subway station was just a few minutes walk from the hotel and there was a big 24-hour supermarket less than 10 min walk (Seiyu). at the ground floor, there is burger king and Saizeriya which was convenient. Although room was small, still a good place to stay. the buffet breakfast was ok

Hotel is a few minutes walk from Toyocho Station. Got supermarket, pharmacy and burger joint adjoining the hotel which was convenient. The room was just nice for s family of four. Very elegant hotel. Considered i think one of the best hotel ib tokyo. We sure did have a good stay

Nice and clean hotel with free shuttle buses to nearest subway station and Disneyland. Helpful and friendly staff. Big supermarket just below and many restaurants around the area. Only issue is the room is a bit small for 4 persons (2 adult & 2 children) but still acceptable with 4 single beds for each person. Overall, a great hotel to stay. May stay here again if visit Tokyo.

I stayed here for 5 days. It was a fantastic place, nice staff, with access to shuttle bus going to the airport, taxi everywhere so you can go to nearby tourist spots easily,they offer bus transportation going to disneyland, supermarket, restaurants, dollar store nearby. The rooms are clean and spacious. Skyline can be seen from the hotel. Buffet breakfast is served daily. A bit away from the busy life of Tokyo but I still enjoyed my stay.

Room was a good size, clean, and comfortable. Hotel Staff were all very friendly and attentive and the Breakfast Buffet was delicious with many options. While the hotel is a ways away from the city center (depending on what you consider the city center, that is), it was incredibly easy for us to walk to the subway and reach all of the tourist destinations quickly. I would just suggest steering clear of morning rush hour if you can - it can be difficult to board the subway headed into the city at that time. But as long as you're bold and don't mind cramming yourself in, you'll be fine.

I’ve stayed here on business trips many times over the last 15 years. I stay here because my company is walking distance. The staff is friendly and attentive. In-house dining is good. American selections for the breakfast buffet is basic but good quality. Asian selections are numerous. The rooms are typical of Japan, small but very clean and well maintained. A bit basic but perhaps because I just get the single corporate rate room. It’s still nice tho. My only complaint is that for me, the bed is extremely firm. A bit too firm for my taste. Access to subway station is only a couple blocks, 5-10 min walk at most. From there, anywhere is easily accessible a fairly short ride away. Subways are very easy to navigate and cheap. There are many resturants nearby, of all different types, several in the same complex. There is a large grocery store next door and an ATM for easy cash access. The hotel itself is probably rated a four star but the atmosphere is very comfortable. I see a lot of business people staying here but then I also see a lot of families and student groups as well. You feel just as at home wearing sweats or a suit and tie. It’s also a short distance to the Tokyo Skytree, a great sightseeing attraction and restraunt/shopping mall. It’s also a great view from one whole side of the hotel. I enjoy looking over the city from my room at night, just beautiful. There are several resturants in-house and a top of the hotel bar with a piano and singer. A bit pricy but not unexpected. I’m not sure if I would call it mid range or luxury. Check out thier website for rates. I don’t think it’s overpriced but it’s not cheap either, but then it’s Tokyo. What’s cheap here? Service, location and values all rate a 4 with me. This form won’t let me use the ratings below. Overall a good place to stay, I recommend it.

This was our first trip to Japan. chose hotel from reading on line reviews and were impressed with how quickly they answered our many email inquires.There were 8 of us and we had some concern about bed size ...no issues. The beds are not queen size but held two non skinny persons very comfortably. The room size is not the normal American room, but it was very clean, there was enough space and all we needed was there. electric hot water kettle, teas, Japanese style cups, TV, mini fridge, comfortable bed and linens. Fabulous Japanese Toto toilet, and brand name toiletries. The wash clots were disposable and a new hermetically sealed one was placed each day as well as sealed toothbrush and paste, Q tips daily and soft cloth covered bands to put up your hair, shaver. Room and bath room super clean. We arrived late at night and check-in was a breeze. My sisters luggage was destroyed by the airline. The next morning they helped her to contact the airline and spoke on her behalf.. Everyone was professional, nicely dressed and so very helpful.. You can walk to the Seven 11 and downstairs in a public space where there is a noodle shop, Burger King ,Tully's;, a full American laid out type Drug store, and other shops, including an Italian restaurant.. The Breakfast places don't open much before am. The only downside is the cost of breakfast if you choose to eat there at the 21.. Lobby is pretty. The bell service great...no tipping. They bring your luggage to curbside when your transportation arrives. Stayed in many 5 star hotels all over the world including Hong Kong and found Hotel East 21 holds its own exceptionally well. The price is very affordable for all you get. This is no "rinky dink" hotel. Feel comfortable booking it. . I would stay there again. It is a about an hour from the cruise pier and in not too near to downtown (central) Tokyo. We stayed 3 nights. Were we to return they have our vote.. . The guest who did recommend was accurate about them not encouraging the lounge /bar for causal sitting, but a minor detail for us. We never worried about the TV and it is Japan where they do not do large and extra large, so small trash bins and a smaller than usual room is within the cultural norm of a primarily Japanese hotel.. We had many people who spoke English and for me who resides in the USA in Miami, Florida where English is a foreign language it was pleasant to speak and be understood or not rudely told that they don't speak English. P.s - allergic to feathers and they brought these marvelous pillows filled with seeds or beads,.. great sleep. No pets!.

I stayed with my family for 9 nights and the hotel was a disappointment. Some good things are the fact that it is surrounded by a supermarket, coffee shops and restaurants of all kinds (however, it takes between 7-10 min to walk to get to Toyocho train station, the closest to hotel). Also, it is good that the Airport Limousine Bus from/to Narita and Haneda Airport stops here. The concierge service is good and they were efficient in booking our Airport Limousine Bus tickets and giving us the right information about things related to Tokyo. Room service was also good, they responded immediately.Unfortunately, the good things end here. There are a lot of things that are not matching average international standards. If the service continues this way, I don't see how the hotel can attract international visitors for the Rugby World Cup 2019 and the Tokyo Olympics 2020. These are the things were the hotel did not do well during our stay:1) Since we traveled with a 1-year old kid, the hotel installed a child guard in one of the beds. The problem was that one day after staff cleaned the room, the child guard was installed in the wrong way, there was a big hole and our son could have fallen through it.2) After check-in, we noticed our room had not been cleaned properly, we found a sock from a previous guest behind a sofa.3) This is the only hotel in the world that I know where guests have to pay to use the gym4) After we checked-out, the front desk forgot to give us a parcel that a friend had sent to us. They only noticed after we had arrived to the airport and they had to send it to us by airmail.(They acknowledged they forgot to give it to us)5) Staff in the lobby lounge were not considerate. One morning, my son asked me to take him to the fountain in the lounge lobby. The lounge was almost empty, one two tables taken. I sat with my son in a sofa next to the fountain and I am asked what I wanted to order. When I told them I was just staying here for my son to watch the fountain, they asked us to leave the lobby lounge, no matter I explained we were staying in this hotel. 6) Some staff in the front desk cannot understand English well.7) Trash bins in the hotel rooms are too small.8) Only one English channel on TV (CNN)My advice is to only stay here if you did not find accommodation in another hotel in Tokyo and/or you have to do something around Koto, Toyocho area

Great hotel, very friendly helpful staff, close to all attractions. Central location. Shuttle service to Haneda Airport & to Dineyland or Disney Sea. Reasonably priced, great large rooms, beautiful view. I would highly recommend this property.

We stayed here for four nights and I felt like a rich man , the service is friendly and welcoming . We booked the family room which had three single beds and a good quality fold out bed which had a great mattress . We were on the 20 floor which had stunning views Highly recommend this hotel for a family A+

Had low expectations for this hotel based on my previous experiences in Japan, but this hotel is definitely a hidden gem. The hotel staff service is impeccable, and the hotel itself is well-maintained and clean. The incredibly convenient and large (relative to Japanese standard) supermarket and convenience stores downstairs along with the restaurants downstairs and the short 5 to 10 minute walk to the T line subway (the hotel is near subway stop T-14) make Hotel East 21 Tokyo a "go-to" hotel for me in the future.

This hotel located 7 mins walk from the metro station. If you carry your luggage and walk from the metro station to the hotel, you may feel a bit tried but it is just a straight road with a few crossing. However, the hotel provides shuttle to the metro station, though only one way and not so frequent. They also have transit to the Tokyo Disneyland, therefore, many families with children stay in this hotel. If you wish to have a quiet breakfast, you may need to take after 8:15 am.There are a big supermarket, a drug store, shops and restaurants in the mall. During our 5 days' stay in the hotel, we had tried some of the restaurants for our dinner and all were up to our satisfaction. We also din in fast food chain restaurants along the road from the metro station to the hotel which served as a stopover after a long day walk.The room was clean and well-equipped. The extra bed ordered was not a folding type which was surprising good. Staff were polite and very considerate. One of the concierge suggested to book a taxi 15 minutes before our departure time to the limousine bus station (to Narita Airport) early in the morning instead of booking one day before to avoid extra reservation charge. Like many of the hotel visitors, we were quite disappointed with the comparatively high charge for using the pool and the gym.

This was a great hotel, location was good near to shops , restaurants and subway. Staff were very friendly and helpful, amazing view from room, room was huge and comfortable with clean towels every day.

Stayed here in June, 2017. The pool area is beautiful, but was closed while we were there. The hotel itself is very basic, nothing extraordinary, but I knew that before booking. Taking taxi is not that expensive, and there is a subway station 10 minutes away. If you do take the subway, make sure you take the right turn when you come out (you should see the hotel in the distance) or have the name of the hotel written in Japanese, so you can ask any of the locals. There is a grocery store and some restaurants on the ground level of the hotel. There are Shiseido toiletries: shampoo, conditioner, body wash, liquid soap. If you are tall, watch your head when stepping into the bathroom, because the floor is raised.

i booked this hotel purposly for the pools. it was expensive to me for one person $32.00usd to use the pool for 1-2 hours only as I wasn't going to use it the whole day anyway. The hotel is nice and well equipped. customer service at the desk were friendly. I didn't know at the time I did the reservation that there is a surcharge to use the pools otherwise I would have booked another hotel with no pools and right in the city area of Tokyo as mostly we were inside the city. we didn't use the pool anyways. if you are looking to go to the city area 3 times a day, the taxi cost is about 21.00 usd one way. thank you

Stayed in this hotel with my family for a week. It was my first time in Japan and I got to say, it was really quite fun and I love it in that hotel. Staffs were really nice. Despite my family know little to no Japanese, my family enjoyed their time there and staff really tried their best to communicate well with us. My Japanese is really poor, yet they still understand it and tried their best to help us. Inside the hotel is really fancy and nice. The room we stayed was amazing and had a really nice view of the city and Tokyo Skytree. Lots of places for food in and around the hotel. There is a small plaza that has a mall, superstore, convenience stores, and groceries below the hotel floor. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Toyo, Koto-ku. I would love to return to this hotel if I need a place to stay in Tokyo. PS: Downside is that it is pretty expensive.

Rooms are a decent size by Tokyo standards (which is renowned for having small rooms). Free Disney Shuttle is a good bonus. There is a small shopping area located under, but, not part of, the hotel which has a supermarket, some places to eat, a pharmacy/minimart, Hungry Jacks & Subway, which is handy. Staff go out of the way to assist and there was always at least one person on duty that spoke English and could help us with things. Only concerns we had during the trip were a couple of nights when we had some really loud people partying in surrounding rooms which impacted on our sleep, but, can't really blame the hotel for other guests selfish behaviour. Hotel is now non-smoking, but, as a non-smoker, I could still smell remnants of when it used to be smoking, but, this is something you are going to encounter in most Japanese hotels - certainly wasn't overpowering and didn't affect our stay - you can tell a real effort is made to continually ventilate the property to get rid of remnant smells. One thing that is an area for improvement - the free shuttle to the subway only runs in the morning. Given that check in is 2 or 3pm, this is not helpful in transporting bags between the station and hotel, nor does it help at the end of a long tiring day when you are faced with that 800m walk. Yes, it's only 10 minutes or so, but, that can be a long way with bags and/or if you are tired. Would like to see the shuttle run all through the day. Other than that, quite happy with our stay at this hotel.

On our trip to Japan, we stayed in four hotels. This was a favourite with our group of 6 people. The staff are lovely, and very helpful. We were given a printed map of the nearest coin laundry - no problem, we appreciated it made so easy to locate. Check in was seamless and we had paid for breakfast which was very nice with a huge variety of foods for everyone. The room was big enough to fir 3 people with luggage and have bit of space which was nice. Beds comfy and best pillows. Bathroom was a good size and had room for your 'stuff' and was very clean and functioned well. Nice views near the elevators of skytree at night. Not far from Toyocho station, but if you have yound children it may be a distance. Has a shuttle to disneyland but must be booked in advance and doesnt run very often. The hotel felt nice and staff were happy and smiled and made you feel welcome. Would stay here again. Heaps of places to eat near hotel and mall underneath with supermarket, bakery etc very good location. wifi was good.

We booked this hotel purposely for access to the pool, which was listed on the hotel website as "available for a surcharge." Surcharge translates to $64/adult on the weekend, $32 during the week day. Children under 13 are $32 and $16.

Although it is bit fat from metro(yet there is a shuttle bus) the location was ok. There is a shopping centre nearby and few eateries around. Room was clean, breakfast choice decent and tasty. Only issue for me as a family party was that kids can't use swimming pool and that it also requires additional charge

Big hotel. Not in the center at all but very easy to get by the underground. A 10 minute walk from the station. Large room ( we were three) coffee pot and glasses. Bring coffee from home. ATM machine in the hotel- bad rate for your money. Next to the hotel; center with variety of restaurants, supermarket, coffee shop.

I stayed there for one week, the location is good, the hotel is good, a bit expensive which make sense in Tokyo but based on the price I expected much better service. The cleaning wasn't so good, I had problems with the bed and had my body itching sometime. Overall I was happy but as I said the hotel wasn't as flawless as I expected.

Overall, we had a good stay at this hotel. We booked the family room which had 4 beds so although the adults were also in single beds, it was very comfortable and quite spacious, especially considering Tokyo size rooms. We had a little table were we ate the nights that we were too exhausted to go out and a fridge. A walking closet and plenty of tables/night stands. Large windows that although you cannot open, had incredible views. Lots of sunshine. Large bathroom with the typical extras on toilet features so the little one kept pushing the warming toilet seat button :)Breakfast was included and excellent considering we were in Asia. Both, Asian and Western options available. Very good espressos and lattes. Service at the restaurant was quick to replace items and the kids ate eggs in every imaginable form of cooking so they were happy. Fresh fruit and all sort of pancakes, waffles, etc.The hotel had a bit of 80/90's look but all was very well maintained. Few options around in case you are tired at night to have dinner or shop to take to your room. Once night we just grabbed chicken sandwiches from BK and were happy with those. After all the walking with the kids, by night, we had very little energy to do much more. They offered a trip to the Tokyo Tower. I didn't go buy my husband/kids enjoyed the views but also mentioned that they kept asking for more and more money to get higher in the tower so find out exactly what is offered before going. They also took a long time to get back. Tube is around 400 mtrs (4 blocks) away. Not too far but something to take into consideration.

Really good and comfortable stay.Pleasant and kind staff.Interior designs are also really beautiful.Good , fresh , very delicious food are been served by them.doors are card sweap so we can trust about the security of room and free wifi also offered by the hotel.

This is where we stay for our first couple days in Japan. The room is spacious and comes with toiletries, slippers and robe. The room we had offered a great view of the Tokyo Skytree. The staff are all courteous and assisted us in booking a cab.

We stayed 4 nights ,1 night before travelling by train through Japan and upon our return 3 nights. We chose this hotel for 2 reasons, we could store our luggage while traveling and hotel offered airport limousine to Narita - twice a day at 8.10am and 2.20pm( not a lot of hotels offer that option).Location is very good, walking distance to Toyocho Station on Tozai Line, only 4 stops to Nihombashi Station - central part of Tokyo. The hotel offers free shuttle bus to the station as well as to Tokyo Disney Resort. Very friendly staff, rooms quite big, some with a view of Tokyo Tower. Very pleasant stay.

Great surprise , did not expect such high standard hotel for this price. excellent service from the reception desk. Just not that it willbe an extra fee if you want to use the pool or gym. Make sure braekfast is included in your price otherwise it will cost 2490 yen .Do not forget to visit the the cocktail bar at the 21:st floor. Fantastic view over whole Tokyo.

The front office staff are very courteous , the Rooms are comparatively big and the Break fast at the restaurant at the Lobby Level was excellent, the spread was grand and oriental. Enjoyed every minute of my stay

Stayed for two nights here, the staffs were very friendly and the room was very comfortable.It's located in East21 shopping center so it's very convenient if you want to buy some snacks or drinks in the mini mart or grab something to eat (other than japanese restaurants, there's also Burger King and Subway there).They also provide bus transport to the airports, 930¥ to Haneda for me, so another plus point there.

Great choice for tokyo stay.Price decent. Rooms clean and relatively large for tokyo.Great to have decent and good priced eatery below hotel. And supermarket there a v big plus.Direct shuttle to disney.7 mins walk to train station.Better to take train from airport than shuttle bus.Definitely top on the list for next stay.

Loved our stay at East 21. Staff were amazing up graded our room helpful in showing us how to get around. Room was spotless nice bed kettle etc in room. Close to Tokyo Tower. From airport we arranged a private pick up service that cost 60$each Aus, from Green Tomato.. to get to train station we got a taxi at the hotel 2100yen.

We stayed here our first night in Tokyo before our train trip into Kyoto. It was in a great location for where we needed to be. Clean, decent sized rooms. Nothing special, but nothing horrible. A great stop off point for us on our first night in Japan. The bathrooms were good sized and extremely clean. Although the room was small, the beds were comfortable.

Its in east part of Tokyo but 8-10 min walk gets you to a subway station. Then you are anywhere you wanna go. As any Japanese hotel I have been in, this one has excellent staff, rooms with baths that even 5star hotels in US would be ashamed by.One thing about Japan hotels is that you get everything you need . I mean everything including the hairbrush ! Rooms are comparable to business suite hotels around US but for half the price. I was amazed that Tokyo was not that expensive coming from California where everything became arm and leg priced.

We stayed here for three nights as part of an organised Japan tour. Being part of an inclusive tour we didn't pay direct to the hotel but as our tour was mid-range I have assumed the hotel cost would be mid-range. The tour company transferred us from the airport but I did notice that the hotel arranges airport transfers. The hotel staff were the usual friendly, helpful and accommodating Japanese standard (so wish this was the standard in UK). Our room was on 14th floor, there were another 3 or 4 floors above, we were lucky to look towards the Sky Tower dominating the skyline in the distance. This was an absolutely fantastic view, especially at night and we had a couple of evening picnic meals in the room looking at the view. In room eating is obviously expected as paper plates and chopsticks are provided. On the catering front, also provided are bottle opener, corkscrew, beer glasses, wine glasses (nice proper glasses), kettle but only 4 japanese tea bags and no teaspoons. The room was not large, possibly slightly too small for the 6 foot wide bed, two 3 foot mattresses with one large duvet, which was comfortable. There was a desk chair, a tub chair and a coffee table, eminently suitable for our picnics. The toiletries were comprehensive and nice quality, also disposable toothbrushes, razors, combs; there were robes and slippers provided and a hairdryer. There was a small fridge but no mini bar, suits us. Wifi was free and worked well. Generally everything was in very good condition not worn out, the carpet was showing signs of wear but within acceptable levels, can't expect everything to be brand new. There was a full size, deep bath with a shower over and a very novel toilet with heated seat and integral bidet with heated water! Everything immaculately clean.Breakfast was buffet with Japanese and western fare with an egg cooking station. The bread & pastries did all run out one morning and took 5 -10 minutes to be replenished but overall good.There is a large supermarket almost directly attached to the hotel.The nearest underground train station is 7-8 minutes walk away, the hotel does run a free shuttle. This gives good access to everything in Tokyo.Judged as a standard style, mid-range hotel this was a great place to stay.

Spent 2 nights at the East 21 at the start of a Japanese tour. We were on the 9th floor which had good views but they will be even better on the 20th floor. The room had all the usual amenities and the staff were all great. We only had breakfast at the hotel which was excellent apart from the queue to enter the breakfast room on the second morning. The hotel sits on top of a small shopping mall including some eating places and there is a Seven Eleven just up the road with an ATM.

We originally chose to stay here because they offered a free shuttle service to the Disney resort. Ended up being a bonus when we walked into our beautiful room! Fancy Japanese style room (was called the "concept room") we were on the 20th floor and the view was incredible. The staff spoke very good English and helped us with many questions and enquirers. The train/subway station was a very easy and quick 9 minute walk straight down the road. The bus was also a very quick 20 minute drive to Disney sea and very easy to organize. You do have to reserve a seat but it's very easy to do at the hotel or online. (Simply change the language to English if need be) there are plenty of food options around the hotel with convenience stores, super markets, bakery, subway, cafe, Italian etc within walking distance. We also ended up staying an extra night but due to it being booked out we had to switch rooms to a regular double-bed room for our third night. It was a lot smaller but it did the job. If your willing to fork out the extra $$$ go for the concept room it's gorgeous and big! Definitely recommend we had a very pleasant stay! (Unfortunately, we regretfully didn't take any photos, it didn't do the view justice anyway)

I stayed at Hotel East 21 in early March 2017. I also stayed there in 2016, but that trip was such a rush that I wasn't able to appreciate everything the hotel had to offer then. On my 2017 trip, I booked extra days. The hotel is very clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. I fell asleep instantly there. I booked a Standard Single Room (like last year- small by US standards) but I was unexpectedly upgraded to a Deluxe Double Non-Smoking room. In-room Wi-Fi works fine (having access to Google was very welcome), and the mini-refrigerator works great, around the clock. Hotel provides complimentary bottled water and a nice set of toiletries, including a folding travel-sized hairbrush (yours to keep). The hotel offers a free Tokyo Disneyland/DisneySea shuttle, as well as a free shuttle to the Tokyo Metro Toyocho Station. That's very convenient on checkout day, so you don't have to schlep your own luggage down the street for 10 minutes walking to Toyocho Station. The Limousine Bus stops at Hotel East 21 twice a day. For a much better price (less than $15 each way) you can take Tokyo Metro at Toyocho Stn. to Nihombashi Stn, and then take the Toei Asakusa Line/Narita Sky Access train to the Narita airport. There's a small mall in the immediate area that has several restaurants, a Burger King, a pharmacy, and a bank of gachapon (toy capsule) machines. Also nearby is a Family Mart and a 7-Eleven for quick on-the-go eats, which are, BTW, of better food quality than anything a US 7-Eleven offers. The price of a room varies widely, depending on time of year and pure luck. I was able to book several days for $69 USD at Hotels.Com, and the next day, the prices for the same room type, same dates went up to $115 USD.

A beautiful relatively small hotel. The staff was friendly, helpful and polite. The pool area is absolutely beautiful. The guest rooms are fairly small by American standards, but more than adequate. Amenities were wonderful. We had a very enjoyable stay and highly recommend this hotel to any Tokyo travelers.

This place is clean and a great place to stay. Nice pool outside but it's too cold for swimming in January so no one in it. Free wifi with room also. Breakfast was really good and a mix of Japanese and western food.

Will return, great staff and rooms a good size. Helpful staff, good food, supermarkets, coffee shops and cafes available with walking distance. Train lines within walking distance of hotel and walking areas along river banks easy to access.

We have been to Tokyo for so many times and would like to stay away from the vibrant suburbs like Shibuyu or Shinjuku and we decided to give this hotel a go. Check in was quick, staff were very friendly and professional. At one time while we took photos at the entrance, a staff from inside came out and took photos for us. What a service. We used this hotel as a base so that we went to Yokohama for a couple of days. Left the luggage at the reception and no problem at all. We were at different rooms in our stay, one faced Tokyo Skytree and the other faced the swimming pool and Disney. We did see the firework from Disney although it’s really far away. No matter which side the room is facing, there’s no worry that you are looking at the building across the street as in some hotels. The rooms were clean and spacious. Windows could be opened to let some fresh air coming in. Complimentary bottle of water was provided every day.There’s disposal plates and chopsticks provided in the room and that will be handy if you want to buy some snack from the nearby supermarket.There’s free shuttle bus to Toyocho station from the hotel 3 rides per hour in the morning. Just only 2 minutes and you will be at the station. What more can you ask for? It will be perfect if the hotel can arrange for the pickup from station and that will save a 10 minutes’ walk back to the hotel

We layover at this hotel on our final night before departing Tokyo. Access is straightforward after getting off Toyocho station. Head for Exit 1 and once you are on the ground level , look out for the 100yen shop that should be visible from the traffic junction. Cross over to the side where the shop is and walk along the path. It should take you about 8-10 mins walk to reach the hotel. You will pass by two 7-11 convenience stores after which you will see the hotel on your left along with a office building next to it. The hotel sits on top of a neighborhood mall where there is a good selection of restaurants as well as a supermarket and a pharmacy.This hotel appears "grand" and not the typical tourist class hotel in Tokyo. However , it is kind of dated as observable from the design and condition of the furnishing. That perhaps explain why the price is not as steep as equivalent ones that have been renovated and in a more convenient location. Our family of four was given a room on the 16th floor with a direct view towards the Tokyo Skytree. The room is comparatively huge by Tokyo standard and we have 4 single beds nicely layout to fit everyone. There is still space for 2 mid to large size luggages. I would give it a 5 stars rating as far as room functionality is concerned.The hotel provides an hourly free shuttle to the Toyocho station in the morning up to noon time. There is also a courtesy shuttle to Disneyland parks for hotel guests that is vey handy for those planning to spend some time at the theme park. More importantly , this is also a stopover point for the airport bus limousine service which saves me a lot of hassle when I depart for Haneda Airport. I believe the shuttle bus to Narita Airport is also available from this hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel for those family with young kids planning for Disneyland and who does not mind a quieter neighbour as compared to the likes of Shinjuku or Shibuya.

The hotel location was pretty good and there were shops that you can go to if you are hungry.Like they built an east21 hall for restaurants and shopping.The hotel is also quite good as the beds are very comfortable.The problem is that the location is a bit far from the more popular places like harajuku,shibuya and shinjuku that takes about 48 mins to reach there.However,it is close to tokyo disney resort and ginza.

We recently enjoyed a 4 night stay at Hotel East 21. The hotel has a good location in a quieter part of the city, and it's only a short walk to Toyocho metro station which allows easy access to the main sights and attractions of Tokyo. There is also a small shopping complex below the hotel which has a nice choice of cafes and restaurants. The hotel rooms are spacious and have excellent facilities and are kept extremely clean. Breakfast was excellent, so much choice for people of all tastes, and all the staff were very friendly and attentive.We also used the free shuttle bus service that runs from the hotel to the Tokyo Disney resort. If we ever visit Tokyo again, we would gladly return to Hotel East 21.

We stayed 3 nights at this Tokyo hotel at the end of November 2016. It is located in a "quieter" neighbourhood with lots of restaurants and smalls shops within walking distance. The room was much more spacious than we had anticipated after reading past reviews. We were able to use the Tokyo subway/rail system very easily and access to the station was a short walk from the hotel. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

The hotel is really beautiful and we got to stay on a high floor so the view is very nice. You can even see the Skytree from one side of the hotel. The bed was moderately hard but still comfortable. The best part is that you get to use Shiseido products in the bathroom. The only downside is that the gym/sauna is not included in the room rate.

We stayed at this hotel for a second time and we still like it. The hotel is clean and adequately roomy, the attendants are nice and polite, going out of their way to help. For some people, 7 min from a metro station maybe a deterrent but once we embraced it as an opportunity to exercise, to absorb the culture, it's better. Actually we grew fonder to the place, venturing more in the neighborhood area, many small restaurants and stores.

Our first hotel in Japan and we were not disappointed!It is comfortable and reasonably priced! It is slightly out the way from the busy Tokyo Station and Shibuya Station but don't worry, you can get there within 15 mins on the underground system.The hotel is a 10 minute walk from its local station, but this is fine....plenty of shops to keep you amuse on the way.Staff very attentive and pleasant. Rooms cleaned extremely well!Would definitely revisit!!

We are here for 2 nights during a trip to Tokyo Disneyland and Disney Sea. The hotel has a comfort room with decent size. Our first night was in Standard single bed (but enough for two peoples!) and face to the Tokyo Skytree, while the second night was in Standard twin room. The disneyland provided the shuttle but from the hotel to Disneyland with 20 minutes travel time. In addition, the hotel provided the shuttle bus from the hotel to near by subway and JR station but the schedule is a little bit tile (only morning to noon) and no shuttle bus for returning trip. Breakfast is a little bit expensive, so we decided to have our breakfast from outside (the plaza in the hotel area). As I said, this hotel is good for your trip to Disneyland/Disney Sea but a little bit far from the subway station for your trip in Tokyo. It is good that if the hotel can provided the shuttle bus or on-request pickup.

My wife and I stayed there for four nights and really liked it. Yes it's a 10 minute walk from the subway but it is a good line and most places aren't too far away. The rooms were if a great size and very comfortable.Staff were very friendly and plentiful however their understanding of English is limited. But we are in their country after all!We didn't use any public facilities so can't comment.Underneath the hotel there are some restaurants and coffee shops but really it is in a business area.For the money we paid it was very good value and would recommend it.

Stayed here as it was just adjacent to our counterpart office. Considered a basic hotel and decent size hotel compared to other japan hotel. Breakfast is really not amazing. Amazingly it is the first hotel that makes me actually would skipped my breakfast.

The hotel has very comfy rooms, and the staffs are courteous. The rooms are good size, and the bathrooms are all clean and have bidet. The view from the rooms are nice. You can see the Tokyo Skytree from the hallway Windows.The hotel is built on top of a shopping center, and has many restaurants and cafes nearby, and close to a convenient store.The main issue with the hotel is the location. The closest subway entrance is about 10 minutes walk. So 20 minutes are spent walking to and from the subway everyday.

I give four instead of five stars only because you have to pay a lot to get access to the swimming pool and/or the gym (30-35 euros each for 1 day). Amazing room and views, a real 4 stars hotel with every amenity and plenty of supermarkets, café and restaurants just at the basement. It is a little far from Tokyo's attractions (you have always to get at least two public transports), but compared to other Tokyo hotels it's a bargain.

This hotel is not very set up for foreign visitors, obviously most during my stay were young groups and japanese families heading for the disney ressort.The most positive I found was the bar on the top floor, a great view, good service and they still serve you snacks after 9pm when the restaurant won't take anyone new.Otherwise I was dissapointed to find wifi only worked in my room, not available in lobby or breakfast area.I tried the gym, it has basic equipment, not very exciting and as I didn't take the extra spa option I was not able to use their changing rooms.At breakfast the tables have napkins, everything else you need to find yourself, it takes a moment.Staff seemed generally friendly however very limited english.My room seemed very small despite king bed, however I think this is quite normal for Tokyo.Would I go back? Yes but mainly for the location I need, it is probably still one of the better hotels in that part of town.

This hotel located out of the center of tokyo. The subway station is 10 minutes from the hotel (have a hotel shuttle bus to the station). The good point of this hotel is that they serve the hotel guest going to the Disney resort and from hotel to the center of Tokyo.The guest room is grooming and comfortable. The good view of Tokyo tower can be seen from the room.

this hotel is located east 21 near Toyo-cho metro station about 7minutes by walk.another way is bus from Kinsi-cho station ,get off Toyosumi-bashi,view is so nice, and valuable stay here.hotel's web sight provide saving price. I like this hotel.many of restraunts and shops are there,Sushi, Steak house,Pasta,pizza, humburger,and pharmacy etc.and two convinience shops are near the hotel.ホテルのページより予約でだいぶセールになっていました。東陽町が最寄りです。バスがありますが歩いて行ける距離です。錦糸町からは豊住橋下車です。まわりにサイゼリヤに寿司屋にフォルクスがあり、大変便利です。コンビニも二軒あります。ディズニーランドのバスもあります。

But this Japan, you may reply. Yes! And hotel East 21 Tokyo is an excellent ambassador for what it represents. Well, it is not a luxury hotel and it has nothing to be jealous from them. Is Tokyo expensive? No! Absolutely not. It deserves the money. But, even a mid range in Tokyo costs a lot. Anyhow, I felt being served luxuriously.

Booked this because it's the #1 rated hotel on tripadvisor in Koto, Tokyo. Price is not too expensive for a weekend stay during summer. Buffet breakfast is very expensive but looks just above average, so we went to some nearby restaurants. Staffs generally speak fluent English, but since the hotel is some distance from Tokyo's most internationalized regions, you can't expect to communicate easily in English outside the hotel. Anyway, there are many good restaurants nearby.Northside rooms have a view of Tokyo Skytree, otherwise you can also enjoy the view in the corridor near elevators. Southside rooms have a decent view as well.CNN and CCTV are available with Japanese dub or subtitles. All other TV channels seem to be Japanese only.

My family stayed for 5 nights. Honestly, I can't say anything negative. The family room is cleaned daily, big enough for 4 adults, sufficient toiletries provided everyday. They provided iron + board for clothes pressing upon request. The hotel staff knows English. There are a number of restaurants surrounding the hotel (Saizeria, Subway, Volks, Japanese restaurants). A supermarket "Smiths" and a drugstore "Create" are just outside the hotel. There are also few convenient stores/restaurants nearby and along the way to the subway. The nearest subway station is Toyocho, which is about 10-15 minutes (long) walk away from the hotel. We just discovered later that there is a free shuttle bus from hotel to Toyocho is available hourly in the morning only.
