There is also a shuttle bus going to Disneyland, Odaiba (hot spring) and Skytree tower. You just need to take note of the shuttle bus schedule. From Toyocho station, you can connect to other train lines in Japan. I only wondered why the swimming pool is not free for guests and why there is only one English channel on TV (CNN). I would recommend this hotel without a doubt!

The rooms were small, I hardly could fit my large suitcases in there. The bed comfortable. Best water pressure I have ever experienced in a shower! Of course the funny toilet seats with heating, and all. Internet was not awesome. The conference hall worked good for us.

My husband and I stayed here in May 2016 for 8 nights. The hotel is less than a 10 minute walk from the Toyocho station on the Tozai Line - which is wonderfully convenient. There are numerous restaurants and take away places (Burger King and Subway) on the hotel grounds. There is a major supermarket, chemist and 100Y shop also. The hotel was clean and the staff were very friendly. We didn't eat at any of the hotel restaurants, but they looked impressive. We did have a drink in the bar on the top floor - nothing like being over 20 floors high on a beautiful day and seeing the Tokyo skyline. Our room was very spacious and definitely big enough for 2 people. In the vicinity of the hotel are many shops and restaurants and a small park. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting Tokyo.

Love the hotel east 21 Tokyo the service was absolutely wonderful very clean and classy. Do not have the buffet dinner not worth the 45$ per person or 4000 yen. I would highly recommend this hotel:) the weather was great and people very friendly and kind

We stayed here at the end of our stay in Tokyo. The staff, including the bellboy and concierge were very helpful and they even had a courtesy shuttle that takes you to the closest metro station. We had a quad room which was very spacious with a beautiful view of the pool.

Stayed here as I was attending seminar in this hotel. Any early check in or late check out beyond the stipulated hours will cost JPY 1000 for each hour. The room I was given had the view of Tokyo Skytree. It was very clean and comfortable. Shower pressure was strong with constant hot water. Room comes with kettle, hair dryer and bedroom slippers too. Wifi connection was consistently strong. The hotel is located above a supermarket, various eateries and restaurants and convenient shops. It takes about 10 minutes to walk from the metro station and close to popular attractions. Highly convenient!

The hotel staff were all very friendly, accommodating, and always very helpful in giving directions and recommendations where to go either for sight seeing, shopping, or dining.The hotel has a good location considerably about 20 - 30 minutes away from Disney Resort using the free Good Neighbor Hotel bus service. Just arrange with the concierge the departure time from the hotel and the pick up time from Disney Resort. We love the surroundings because it gives you a subtle side feeling of Tokyo. Within the hotel grounds, you might already find what you need, we frequented this place everyday. There is a supermarket where you can buy everything from food, water, chocolates, and all sorts of Japanese products. There is a Create drug convenience store where you can buy face mask (during spring), beauty products, medical products, and many things. There is Saizeriya, a value for money Italian restaurant, always a good place to eat. There is a dollar store. When we arrived at the hotel from Narita, we immediately tried the ramen restaurant nearby, it was great. There is a Japanese shabu-shabu restaurant which we had a great experience dining. Burger King. We also had a good time at the nearby Volks, a family restaurant specializing in steaks. And many more shops just within the surroundings of the hotel. The hotel is also very near the Tokyo Skytree tower, where you can get a breathtaking view of Tokyo, I suggest to go there in the evening to see the city lights. Fantastic. To go around Tokyo, it is best to take the Metro trains, and the Toyocho station is just 15 - 20 minutes walk from the hotel.Our family size is four adults and the hotel had a room for us that has four beds! We were surprised with the spacious room and the free WIFI is fast. We loved the bathroom amenities, the nice smelling shampoo, conditioner, and body wash. I wish I could have asked the hotel if I can buy a set to take home. You always get a warm and comfortable feeling whenever you use the toilet. The beds are comfortable. There is a TV where you can watch local cable channels and prepaid movies. The small luggage room is very useful to store almost everything we shopped.When you visit Tokyo, I recommend staying at Hotel East 21 Tokyo. When my family comes back to visit Tokyo, we will definitely stay at this hotel again.

I felt cheated as nothing is included. At first I thought I might have made a mistake and that breakfast was not included and then I am being told the gym to not included nor is the swimming pool and then TV is excluded except CNN. This is ridiculous and no one gets the point because they are struggling with English. To be avoided.

The hotel staff was very professional and curteous to us. Rooms are clean and come equipped with things we may have forgotten like toothbrushes and razors :)Only thing I didn't like was the fact that admission to the pool is not included in the hotel stay. It will cost you about $32 USD if you want to take a dip.

A good hotel at a equally good location . Its about 20 mins by metro to Tokyo Station. Also have fastfood joints , restaurants , and supermarket in the vicinity . It helped us , we being vegetarians . The room was fairly large , to accomodate 3 beds . The housekeeping was good too . They have shuttle bus to the nearby Toyocho stattion.

Lovely Japanese hospitality here. The rooms are small but that is Japan . Indoor pool access comes at a high premium approx 3140 yen - around $30 AUD . Avoid over priced restaurants on Level 21 but view is nice oh and besides movies the only tv channel that is in English is CNN

Went with a few friends. The hotel was stunning and clean. The staff friendly and pleasant. Transportation via the subway was a few blocks away. We were happy to be in the city but on the outskirts. There's also a large grocery store located very near so breakfast options and whisky were very easy to get for affordable pricing.
user_name:
Amy T B
Syracuse, New York

review_body: Having been to Tokyo before and having stayed in two pretty small rooms, we decided to pay the extra $$ as our 11yo was accompanying us on this trip. We got a triple room with 3 single beds to accommodate us all. It wasn't overly squishy as far as room sizes go, we were all quite comfortable. There is a mini fridge in the room and tea making facilities. The bathroom is an ok size. It is a less than 10 minute walk to Toyocho station. The hotel does run a shuttle bus to the station if need be. A 7/11 is close by as well as a number of other convenience stores, restaurants and they have a 24 hour McDonalds next to the train station. On site, there is a Burger King, Tullys Coffee and other food eateries. The staff are really friendly and professional. The hotel itself is getting a little old now but it is clean and in a great place. Nice and quiet away from the hustle and bustle. I'd stay here again.

Room clean and tidy bathroom fully equipped. Space minimalist but fuctional for two people. Did not have safe asked and was delivered. Bus from Narita airport and Haneda airports direct. Subway station about 10mins walk, choice of restaurants surrounding the hotel. With the exception of some staff very little English spoken, but attentive to your needs. Good internet speed in the room and lobby.

Good hotel located close to town. We used to walk down to the station to take the Toyoko train into town or to the subway line. On our last day we found out that there is a shuttle that departs down that direction at various times of the day. The rooms get super cleaned. The cleaning staff literally stay on one floor the whole day. We had a great room overlooking Skytree. The TV doesn't show any english channels so you're best to get out and about. There is a supermarket downstairs and if you walk a little further up there are old guys fishing!
user_name:
Vincent C
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: If you are arriving at Haneda airport take the No 5 from outside Arrivals. It takes you to the entrance to the hotel.Check in was quick and we were pleasantly surprised by our room. A large comfortable bed with new linen daily. A sitting area. Tea making facilities. Air con.Each day we had new slippers, new night shirts and new toiletries in the bathroom.These included hair brush, tooth brush and tooth paste, razor and shaving cream plus the usual. The hand soap was so smooth.I must mention the heated toilet seat- next time I will take a longer book!The staff were most helpful although sometimes their English was not too good.Buffet style breakfast was better than good, providing you tried some japanese dishes.We thought that the prices for evening meal were too costly so we ate in the local shopping Mall which was directly outside the hotel. Volks steak house was well priced and the steak excellent.The hotel is some distance from the main attractions but there is a Metro station about 7 minutes walk from the hotel and this gives you access to the underground system.There is a minibus shuttle from the hotel to the Skytree.There is also a minibus shuttle to Tokyo Disneyland.I would recommend this hotel

Nice, cosy, cool and calm place. Situated away from the hustle and bustle which is a rarity in Tokyo. Sky Tower was clearly visible from the hotel room. Room with 4 beds was comfortable except that one of the beds was sofa cum bed which was not so comfortable. Upkeep and maintenance was good. Breakfast costed 2300 yen per person which was on the higher side. All in all, a nice experience.

The hotel check in was slow. The room i have was standard. It's such a hot day after check in so i decided to give the pool a go...went to L4 for their indoor pool..to my unpleasant surprise. U have to pay at least 2000 yen to access, then i made my way to L5 for their outdoor pool..another shocking surprise. ..it displayed a closed signed. ..i called up front desk afterwards..they said the pool is open during dry season...i responded to staff..it is 25 degree and sweating..you tell me this pool is not open 24/7, 365 days...to make things worse..you have pay to use it. Seriously what hotel on earth which is classified 4 star hotel and charges pool access. I got FREE access at Marina Bay Sand and they're 5 star hotel..SERIOUSLY NO WONDER YOU DON'T MAKE IT ON 5 STAR...So why bother highlighting the pool sooo glamourously and why soooo misleading that you can't mention on your stupid website that hotel guest would incur a charge.Attached their misleading website...NO RATES AT ALL

Our family of 4 stayed here in May 2016 in a quadruple room for 4. Our view from the 20th floor was amazing with the SkyTree in full view. The attached shopping has dining and shopping options at affordable prices.The staff are very friendly, many of whom speak at least some English. The train station is just a few blocks away so all of Tokyo is within easy reach.

I stayed 4 nights and I feel comfortable. I took breakfast outside. From Tokyo station it coast 2400 yen by taxi. The nearest tube station is Toyocho ( Tozai line), 10 minutes walk. Next to the hotel, there is supermarket and several restaurants. I think it is good to come in this hotel in summer time because there is a hudge swimming pool. The breakfast buffet coasts 2900 yen ; very expensive and not enough variorities.

Deserved every one of its four stars, grade A+ customer service (everyone speaks impeccable English, too!), nice comfortable rooms at a decent (not outrageous) rate right close to the Toyocho station in Koto Ward, Tokyo, accessible for all of Tokyo via metro Tozai line. Certainly somewhere I would seek out and stay again.

Exceptional hotel with every comfort and service. Highly recommended and would have loved to stay on longer.Really good breakfast, comfy room and cleaned to a high soecification.Local facilities vey good in same complex, dont forget to see the carp shop!

Great hotel! Rooms are comfortable and clean. Breakfast buffet was amazing, full of choices for everyone. The hotel is within walking distance to the metro station (10 to 15 mins) and there are 3 convenience stores (and kind of a big supermarket) in the lower part of the hotel. There are also several restaurants there (pizza one was good!). We really enjoyed our stay there!

Fabulous hotel, clean, safe, good shopping area & not far from the metro. Lovely breakfast with plenty of choice, great views of the Skytree, quiet area so no disturbance at night. Loved the warmed mirror in the bathroom which kept it clear in a steamy atmosphere, a little thing but I thought it was a great idea. Lots of small touches which make a big difference to the overall stay.

We stayed at the hotel twice: 3 days prior to a tour and 1 day after. Both our rooms were on the 15th floor. The first one seemed a bit larger, but both were good sized, clean and comfortable with good amenities. The shower was excellent.We really appreciated the front desk's good service. Check in was quick . They were always happy to provide maps and suggestions as to where to go and they went out of their way to provide spa pillows for my daughter who is allergic to feathers. Although not central, there a restaurants, a Seven- Eleven and a market under the hotel and it is an easy 10 minute walk to the metro.

Good hotel, still new I guest, lower area they have sushi resto and other, 3 convenience store surrounding hotel. but the problem is the sites of the hotel is 8-10 minutes walk to the nearest Metro station (Toyocho metro-Tozai line). so if you want to explore Tokyo fast you will have a difficulty to move fast, to shibuya it will take 30-45 minutes, to Tokyo station-15min.The hotel is not in the middle, its abit off from Tokyo, but if you look for good view to watch sky tree, its a best spot.

Cleanliness is a given in Japan, as is polite service. Most staff speak English which is a help in Japan because it's hard to find English speakers in most places. Higher rooms have great views of the city and if you are on the right side the Sky Tree. Restaurant is excellent although rather pricey for tourists. Food cooked in front of you by excellent chefs it was quite an experience although we only ate there once.

Check-in was quick and painless, with all staff I encountered being very helpful and polite, as is the custom in this lovely country.My reservation was made a bit 'last minute' and, travelling solo I ended up in one of the smaller rooms, still with a double bed and usual facilities. The room, as with the whole hotel, was spotlessly clean and comfortable. Room size was, I would say, generous for Tokyo. A bit of maneuvering was required in the bathroom to get into the shower, avoiding the door and toilet. Much fun was had, as always, playing with the electronic toilet. The view from my twelfth floor window over this part of Tokyo was spectacular.The hotel had a wide range of excellent facilities, none of which I used. The wi-fi was generally reliable.I avoided using the lobby bar, as it was always devoid of other people, possibly down to high prices. I never quite made it up to the cocktail bar on the 21st floor, preferring to explore the city.Personally I found the location to be convenient enough. It is a little bit 'out East' if Shinjuku or Shibuya is your bag, perhaps 45 mins on the Metro avoiding rush hours (which you would be wise to do). But Shimbashi, Ginza and Tsukiji are all within easy reach. The Tozai line (Toyocho station) is an easy & pleasant five minute walk away. For those quiet nights or if you wish to avoid elbowing your way through central Tokyo, the area around East 21 has plenty of options - places to drink a beer, more choice in restaurants than you could ever need, small shops and good coffee for the morning.I'd happily stay with East 21 again.

Hotel is comfortable, room was clean, has everything what it was supposed to have. Breakfast was very good a lot of food to chose. Staff is very polite and helpful. Location is pretty far from almost everywhere, about 10 min walking distance to subway. Small mall by the hotel has some good supermarket and decent amount of restaurants
user_name:
Eugene R
Fair Lawn, New Jersey

review_body: This hotel is quite nice, al-be-it a little far from everything. Subways are a must to get from one place to the next in the city. The view (our room at least) was spectacular.) If you don't have a view, go up to the bar on the 21st floor for a 360 look-a-round.

I stayed at this hotel for a whole week in March 16 while on a business trip. This being my first trip to Tokyo, I was expecting small rooms and a crowded locality. However to my pleasant surprise, I found the hotel room most spacious and very well laid out. On a clear day, if you are lucky, you could also catch a glimpse of Mt. Fuji.Japan, known for its perfection and sense of artistry was prominent everywhere in the hotel. Very well decorated, perfectly organised and spotlessly clean. The staff are most polite and courteous. Language is usually not an issue. The breakfast spread was wholesome with a full spread of Japanese as well as western food which even vegetarians would not find difficult.A cool limousine bus ride to the airport, for which you need to buy tickets in advance, is an extra benefit.I must say that I had a memorable stay at this hotel and would strongly recommend it to others.

Interiors and cleanlinessThe hotels interiors may be dated but the staff managed to keep the entire place clean. Our room was cleaned, vacuumed (don't ask me how I know, but I know!) and organized daily. As expected they had the famous Japanese toilets with heated seats. Part of the mirror also had heaters to prevent fogging.Hotel StaffThe staff we spoke with all tried to understand our English with the Filipino accent. They would also try to converse with us in English. If it seemed that we didn't understand each other, they would make the effort to explain directions to us to make sure we do not get lost. There were a few things we didn't fully understand but that's totally forgivable given the language barrier.TransportationThe hotel was close to Disney and there was even a free bus from the hotel to the resort. It was also just around 30-40minutes to Haneda airport. However, it was a long 15-20 minute walk to the nearest subway so we ended up taking the taxi a lot. It helped that they have estimated costs and arrival time for all the transportation available. Other transfers and tours are offered at the hotel lobby. Just don't forget to ask if you need to pay for them.ConvenientI think it was very convenient that there was a small commercial area within the hotel's property. We were very close to restaurants allowing me to sneak in sushi while my mom was already in the room. When I was feeling cheap, I could even get sushi or dinner from the supermarket nearby. I was also a daily customer at the convenience store nearby. :)

The service was excellent, very attentive and friendly staff, room spacious and very comfortable, decor tasteful, location close to sites and local Parks. Lots of choice of foods for breakfast served.

Breakfast was great. The room was very spacious and comfortable. I love the stores nearby. The staff where very accommodating. When I emailed them about leaving some clothing behind, they sent it back for me for free.

Stayed here only two nights. Our room had a nice view of the area. We took a half day tour of Tokyo and then took the subway to Disneyland. The hotel provided a free shuttle that took us back to the hotel from Disney. The breakfast buffet was great. Love the western and Japanese items served.

We stayed for one night. There are quite a few little shops around the hotel area and a few restaurants inside the hotel. We ended up eating at Toen, the Chinese restaurant inside the hotel. The service was excellent as was the food. Everything was expensive though. The hotel rooms were very tiny, which is to be expected in Japan. We had a full size bed that took up the entire room. I almost couldn't get off the bed from one side. The table and chair were super close to the bottom of the bed and no real place to push them out of the way with the desk being on the other side of the table. With two full size luggage pieces and a couple duffle bags, this was a pain. The shower and amenities were good. I appreciate the fact they are trying to cut back on waste by not providing the little shampoo/conditioner bottles that often go half used and tossed away. They provided shampoo and conditioner in large reusable bottles. Be sure to check out the great views of the city from the 21st floor. There is a separate express elevator that will take you directly to the 21st hotel. Also, this was about a less than 10 minute walk from the subway. Although we visited in winter, would love to stay here during the summer. Their 3 pools look amazing. Two are outdoors and one indoors. Very beautifully decorated.

Comfortable rooms, a shopping plaza thing outside. The Sushi place in the Plaza was good, compared to american sushi places anyway. The breakfast was better than most in the places we went to. My main complaint is that it was far from most of the stuff we wanted to do.

Nice 3-4 stars hotel with excellent front desk service. The room was comfortable, clean and the bed was good. The decoration details are nice. The internet is good and free.The hotel is a short walk from the Toyocho Metro station, there are many restaurants and commodity stores around.

very comfortable beds, big rooms for Japanese standard. I got the "other" view but it was still nice and impressive from 19th floor. very clean. good sound proofing. smoking rooms in the lobby so no need to go out and be cold. a lot of basic shops and convenience store 24/7 and supermarket nearby, as well as few restaurant. quite close to the metro station, unfortunately need to transfer and takes a while to get to most popular places, shibuya is 30-35 minutes away but it's ok. had a great stay!

The hotel is in a tall building located at 7 minutes on foot from the Toyo-cho station of Tozai metro line. As the sidewalk was good, the distance from the station was not issue even with luggage. However if you arrive at the JR Tokyo station and foresee to take the Tozai-line, the nearest station is far from the JR station. In such case, you had better to go to the JR Kinshi-cho station and take a bus bound for the Toyo-cho station, or take a taxi.My double room was on the 17th floor, South side, clean, with good quality furniture, a wide screen TV and a clear view on Tokyo bay area. The hotel offered me discount tickets for cleaning and fitness. The breakfast was western, japanese and chinese viking one. I remarked relatively few items for japanese dishes which I disturbed a little. There are shopping arcades with a supermarket at the foot of the building.

Access by Toyocho Station is easiest. There is a huge local supermarket and drug store located downstairs in the hotel complex area; the supermarket was fun to explore for local food and fresh produce (cheaper than konbini by far and very interesting). There are some restaurants around the area, otherwise not too much to do overall in the area. The hotel is not the easiest to walk to (about 7-10 min walk from station to hotel), and is a quiet area after business hours.There was a small free shuttle minibus between the hotel and Toyocho Station; you should check the times with hotel as it doesn't run the whole day (I think the first half of the day only).Room was comfortable; size was fair. Double bed size was equivalent to having two pillows immediately beside each other.

Opulent it's not, however we thoroughly enjoy this hotel and its amenities. In addition to metro station, there are many eateries, convenient stores and even a large supermarket right in the complex. We did not get the Skytree view but the city view is splendid enough. Concierge is very helpful. We will definitely stay here next time.

The rooms are big from Japanese standard and have everything you need to have. Restaurant is good with big breakfast selection. It is a very Japanese experience. A bit far for metro. I would come back on my next trip

Comfortable Staying at the Japanese traditional room 2016 with view bath of SkyTree. Just 30 minutes to Disney World and shuttle bus to airports. Cross to Ginza and Toyota museum. Very convenient location, but very reasonable price. Good hotel in Tokyo. 障子が和風を感じる素敵な部屋と檜の香りがホッとするビューバスで寛げます。ホテル周りには、人気鮨店やイタリアン、スーパーと地下鉄東陽町駅からも近く、ディズニーランドへも30分の老舗オークラのホテルは、超オススメ‼︎

I stayed here for a conference for a couple of says. The room was decent size for Japan standards, bed comfortable, good WiFi signal. Breakfast spread was average. They have a gym, but charge 2500-3500 yen depending on the time of day. However, there is a park nearby where you can walk or jog. Shuttle bus to the Metro that goes direct to Tokyo station, about 5 stops and also goes to the Tokyo aquarium and Tokyo Disney. You can also walk to the metro, about 3-4 blocks. Overall, the service was excellent. You could get a cab and have it billed to your room.

Hotel East 21 disappointed me a little. The major reason for this was the quality of the room. It would be equivalent to the older version Holiday-Inn. The hotel is located on the east side of Tokyo. You will need to travel by metro to get to any major attractions in the city. Just don't count on the staff to give you travel advice. The walls were very thin, but the other guests were very considerate so the noise is minimal.Positives:- shops close by (full grocery, CVS-like store, restaurants)- free wifi (if it is working)- heated toilet seatNegatives:- old, dated room (decor, furniture)- staff knew very little to no English- tiny bathroom- $30+ very expensive for gym usage- 10 minute walk from Toyocho metro station (gets a little old if making frequent trips to/from this station)

I tried a low budget backpacker trip and decided to stay in this hotel. The price is a bit high but the receptionist, services, breakfast and wifi is excellent. Just unfortunately They gave me a bad view from my room.

We stayed at this hotel with the Affordable Asia Japan Tour. The way the tour worked out, we were there 2 nights in the beginning of the tour, and one night at the end. The first 2 nights we had a very nice room with a lovely view. The room was a nice size and had everything that was needed, and more (small disposable towels to take along, which are nice, as bathrooms rarely have paper towel dispensers. There were also hair ties along with other helpful items). The wifi also worked well. Sometimes it's just the little things!Our room, on the second part of our stay, was nice also. The view wasn't as good, but it was comfortable and worked just fine.Breakfast was included, and was plentiful. Just about everything you might want for breakfast was available. If one couldn't find something they liked, traveling might just not be the thing to do!We ate dinner twice near the hotel. The first was in the area out of the hotel on the first floor near the very handy grocery store. There were few customers in the restaurant, but we both enjoyed our meals. Unfortunately, I can't remember the name of it, but it seemed tempura was their specialty (that's not terribly helpful!!) The second was a sushi restaurant (Sushizanmai), that was really wonderful. It's at the bottom of the escalator to the left. Don't miss it if you need a sushi fix while you're staying there. We also had dinner one night at the hotel. It was a buffet, and was fine, but I wish we had ventured out instead. Maybe next time!All in all, it was a great stay. This was our first trip to Japan, and we thoroughly enjoyed it. It is a lovely, amazingly clean country and we met gracious, kind people everywhere we went. Oh, and as a side note: the bathrooms are incredible!!

The good - far enough from the hassle and smog of Tokyo proper; 5 - minute walk to subway. Close to city park. The bad - tiny beds, tiny room, room not sound proof, staff needs to learn more English comprehension skills.Overall - not worth the price, stay some other place.

Sorry I'm not very good at reviews so here goes. I am staying here with my family and this is a clean and happy place. The staff are helpful and if they don't know something they'll find out for you. Is in an easy to get to place near most places you want to go to. Very near the metro. Not a lot to do near by but it's quiet and very clean. Bit expensive but with the money. Will be coming here again.

The location of hotel about 10 min walk from Subway Tozai line , Toyocho station. The hotel staff are very helful and kindly, we drop the luggage and book the free shuttle bus from / to Disneysea. The bus available from Hotel to both Disney resort (disney land /disney sea) daily with the specific time table. When we return from Disneysea, our luggage already deliverd to the room . We did to fill the form for check-in while we drop the luggage in the morning, We collect the key from the Front desk and toward to the room. The room was tidy and views are great, there is a big glass windows are facing TOkyo Skytree.

Immaculately clean, as I realize most Japanese hotels are. Fairly spacious, considering this is a hotel in Tokyo where most hotel rooms are a display of innovative space saving ideas.It is a Disney “Good neighbor” hotel ie it provides a free bus shuttle service to and from the Tokyo Disney Resort. They take advance bookings each day till 3pm at a separate desk from the reception. They will show you different time slots and where you need to wait for the bus at the resort for the return trip. It takes about half an hour to get to/from Tokyo Disneyland, and slightly longer to get to/from Tokyo Disneysea.What are provided in the room: bedroom slippers (changed daily), Shishedo brand of face/hand soap, shampoo, rinse (ie hair conditioner) and body soap, shower caps, toothbrushes and toothpaste, hair rubber band, kettle, tea sachets, sleeping robes (fastened by buttons instead of just with a sash so they feel more secure!), bath tub, strong wifi (in room only !! Not elsewhere in the hotel).What we would have liked: a safe.Breakfast is buffet style. There is Japanese food, rice porridge, bread and jam, cereals, pancakes, food cooked the Asian way, and an egg station where a chef prepares scrambled egg of your choice, or sunny side up. Or you can take a hard boiled egg from the station. There is a decent variety but the food is about the same each day so if you stay for more than a few days you may find it boring.The reception is on level 2. If you go down to level 1 via the lift or stairs inside the hotel, you can get to a mall by a sheltered walkway within minutes. There are eateries there (including Burger King, Subway, Saizeriya, several Japanese restaurants), a supermarket, a 100yen store (akin to Daiso but even cheaper! With VAT it is only 108 yen per item. The made-in-Japan ones are the best).Ask at the Front Desk for a map – it shows the opening hours of all the eateries there and also directions to the nearest metro station (Toyocho; about 10minutes’ brisk walk away; there is a shuttle that takes you to the station too but I think it does not operate on weekends).We were there when the 8.5 strong earthquake struck in the ocean. There were a few announcements….all in Japanese so we were rather lost. Only the final one was made in English as well. We would have expected them to make announcements in a few languages besides Japanese, depending on the nationality of the guests who are staying there at the time.To summarise, it is well contained and a good economical alternative to a Disney hotel but if your intention is to be right in the heart of the action then this hotel is slightly out of the way.

Location is little tricky, as the nearest subway station is a good 10 minutes walk away. But once you get familiar with the surroundings it's very convenient. There is a supermarket downstairs and a complex full of various shops and services. Rooms are super clean, cozy and quite small - a normal thing for Japan. The view to the Tokyo sky tree from our room was stunning, especially in the evening. Staff is friendly ,efficient yet not very flexible - if you arrive 1:30pm you have no chance of getting your room even if hotel is half-empty. Official check in time is 2pm, period. Don't expect any courtesy or policy bending over this.

A short walk from the metro station giving easy access in to Tokyo centre. Outside of the hotel is a bit off putting but it has a beautiful art deco style inside.The rooms were very clean and comfortable and breakfast was very good. Standard of service is high and although the bar and restaurant prices were a bit on the high side, the food in the steak restaurant was delicious and the view of the Sky Tree amazing. Well worth it.

We are staying one week at this hotel. Staff are very friendly, Breakfast costs around 25 Euro additional per Person. In hotel description it says that a gym and a indoor pool is accessable for hotel guests. what it not said is that the usage of these facilities costs 35 Euro per person for each day! Unbelievable!!We re very unsatisfied now... also no bottle of water included.The positive are: clean, quite, near a metro station.

Good service, good facilities, quiet comfortable room (a bit small, but that's normal for Tokyo), great night-time view from the top. But the hotel is out to the East, well away from the city centre, and it's a 10 minute walk from the nearest Metro station, so the location isn't great for most people. There are some local shops and restaurants nearby, but not a lot of any real interest.

+1 for Comfort: The best! The room, 1601, was large by Tokyo standards, with an excellent view of the Tokyo Sky Tree. Brand new television, fridge, small table and chair, and a large bed.+1 for Extras: Dining facilities on site, as well as in the shopping complex next door. There is also a supermarket next door and a dollar (100 yen) store. Everything you could need is either in the hotel or a 1 minute walk (except the rail system). The are also taxis parked on site seemingly at all times.+1 for Service: Outstanding service starts as they great you on the way in. No shortage of staff eager to help.+1 for Value: We booked this as part of a tour package but were happy with that price. I assume the price for the hotel itself was reasonable.Other: This hotel would be perfect if it wasn't a 10 or 15 minute walk to the transit station (Toyocho). If you are carrying luggage, it's not the best walk. It is a straight-shot to the station, however, so no getting lost. And you can see the hotel from the station.

I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights because it was near the office I was visiting. The metro station is less than 10 minutes walk from the hotel. There was a supermarket underneath the hotel and you can find a 100 yen shop inside the supermarket. The room size considered OK in Tokyo, the deco was dated but the hotel was very clean. However just beware that this hotel is used by tour operators so expect queue at breakfast some mornings. Overall my stay was good except for one night where a bunch of kids next door was having a gathering till 3am. The sushi restaurant in the compound was very good so worth to give that a try.

Great toilets! Room was comfortable and the staff very friendly. Breakfast was good quality and in sufficient quantity. The scrambled eggs were a strange color and somewhat undercooked but the rest of the offerings were well prepared. The hotel is somewhat off the beaten path, but public transportation is close by.

My family stayed in a Japanese style family suite for 5 days. The room was so comfortable and clean. It even has a big bathtub made with hinoki wood. The service level of the staff was always very high. 7 minutes walk from subway station also made it very convenient for travellers wit with children (although the subway trains can be EXTREMELY crowded at rush hours). There is a shopping mall under the hotel with supermarket and many restaurants, even a great sushi restaurant that opens until 11pm.

Overall, the hotel was decent. The rooms were a good size for Japan. The staff was professional and friendly. There was a a couple of miscommunication but that was mainly due to the language barrier. We made a reservation for the shuttle to disneysea and they only booked us a one way ticket. So just make sure that you also reserve a seat for a return shuttle, if not you'd either have to take the subway back or pay for a taxi. The breakfast in the morning is a mixture of Japanese and American food. There are plenty of places to eat near the hotel. There's a subway, burger king and couple of Japanese restaurants. There's also a supermarket near by. The hotel itself is far from downtown. You would have to take the subway. Make sure to buy a 'one day' subway pass. Also the subway closes at midnight so make sure you're back to the hotel by then. We took that taxi home and it costs us a little over $50.

The hotel has it all - near restaurants, shops, grocery. Room as are a little smaller the average but is a norm in Japan. Heated toilet seats with bidet was wow. There's a burger king, subway , 100 yen store and grocer store near hotel. It's a 30 minute subway to downtown Japan. It's a Disney neighborhood hotel with shuttle to Disney. The rate is doable. Staff is helpful. Breakfast buffet is ample with Japanese and American menu. Japanese bed are firmer than average.

My husband and I loved this well located hotel. Very impressive at first sight, clean and spacious with extremely helpful and smiling staff who couldn't do enough for us. They may not have spoken the best English but they tried their very best and we never had a problem. Our room (1701) had a breathtaking view of the city and was cosy, spotless, well appointed and had various complimentary toiletries not to mention the all important japanese toilet! We had an in room massage one evening which was wonderful and well needed after much sightseeing. Breakfast was varied and delicious. Perfectly situated for Disneyland (free shuttle bus available) and only an 8 minute walk to the Toyocho metro which could get you basically anywhere you wanted in Tokyo in up to 25 mins. The sushi restaurant 'Sushizanmai' directly under the hotel was fantastic and reasonably priced, we loved the sushi so much we went there 2 nights running. You will not regret booking this lovely hotel, we would happily stay here again and recommend it to friends.

We only had 24 hours in Tokyo on our way to another location and this hotel was a nice choice. The staff was helpful and the room was clean with comfortable beds. We were traveling with a toddler, so I would have rather stayed closer to some of the areas we wanted to see. But it was still nice.

Tokyo East 21 is a big (business) hotel with organized shuttle bus services (to airport, to train station, to Disney etc.). Room are decently sized (believe me, I have stayed in several Tokyo hotels and many have rooms the size of a shoebox) but we traveled in a group of 3 and added an extra bed - the room became rather packed with not much space for luggage. Pic attached.Note that there is a possibility of adding 2 extra beds (1 at walkway perpendicular to beds), our neighbor did that but they probably slept with their luggages at the door or on their beds.Bathroom was very clean & well stocked with supplies including Shiseido face wash. Wireless internet available but not stable (I was way faster on phone's 3G than wifi). F&B: There's a supermarket right below the hotel (tip: buy cheap sushi there & be sure to grab some of those Jap mangoes, strawberries, honeydew! They're mad sweet & cheap at the supermarket!), a 100-yen store in the supermarket, some restaurants, Burger King etc. Restaurants are also available across the road.Location: It's far from.. City places like Shinjuku/ Shibuya etc. but near Disney. Hotel bus ride to Disney takes around 15 mins, but please book your bus trip in advance if you're using hotel shuttle to Disney. Late rides to return after the Disney fireworks show are usually full a few days in advance. However, if you booked a later ride & would like to hop onto an earlier bus from Disneyland - that's also possible, they're rather flexible. The hotel also provides shuttle services to the nearest subway station (Toyocho) as well as airport buses. Ask for the bus schedules at concierge.Train from airport to hotel with several station changes took about an hour.Hotel is about 10 mins walk from the nearest subway station, no problems for leisure walking but we had some situational grumbles - like when walking there dragging 2 full luggages per person or when our legs were breaking after a full day shopping. Service was great, though they sent me back to the room when I was in slippers to smoke downstairs once. Slippers not allowed downstairs, I was told.Overall above average and value for money but won't return for my next stay.. cause of its location. Recommend to stay here if you're on budget.

We had an extended connection at Narita (~15 hours) and wanted to spend the night in the city with a visit to the fish market in the wee hours of the morning.Hotel East 21 proved to be the perfect place for us to stay. The hotel is convenient and cozy. Everything--as elsewhere in Japan--is absolutely sterile and there is not a speck of dust anywhere. Staff are incredibly polite and willing to help; however, note that English is limited. Rooms are standard--safes, phones, free internet, flatscreen TVs. Bathrooms are clean and well-stocked. Don't be alarmed at the heated toilet seat with water jets.This is a very safe bet for a comfortable stay in Tokyo!

I am still staying here and this is our second night. I am enjoying it so far and the staff are fantastic. Those who need it speak English quite well. The buffet breakfast is amazing and has both western and Japanese foods. They have a shuttle that leaves pretty regularly to take you to the local Toyocho station as well as some other places I believe. This is a huge bonus for lazy folk like me and is super handy when the weather stinks. I'm pretty slow so for me the walk is about 10-15 mins. The hotel is close to many restaurants that are reasonably priced. Last night we tried a soba restaurant and it was both amazing and cheap. There are a few convenience stores close which has some great snacks. I think Lawsons makes some great sushi. As far as the hotel in general goes, I'm not enjoying the bed, it's very hard and we both woke up with sore backs. It is very quiet and cozy, no annoyances. As far as amenities goes it's pretty on the low side, but you don't come to Tokyo to hang out in your hotel. Maybe bring some tea bags if you're a fan because they charge you for those. Internet access is okay but meh at times. I'm still enjoying my visit so if anything else comes up I will add. Also if you haven't been to Japan before I highly recommend learning to say a few things in Japanese, it really goes a long way here and it's nice to show the locals you have gone to some effort My Japanese has really gone over well! .I also recommend getting a Suica or Passmo card for the trains, it's a much easier way to pay your fare! Jamatene!

You can reach the hotel directly from Haneda or Narita Airport using "The Friendly Bus", however, the time may not suit you. You can always go to central bus station (TCAT) which goes every 20 mins and then take a taxi to the hotel (approx US20). You may reach the hotel quicker than waiting for the next direct bus.Deciding where to stay in Tokyo should be based on close proximity to train station and affordability. This hotel is approximately 10 mins walk from closest train station, within minutes from convenience stores such as 7 eleven. There are a variety of affordable restaurants in the complex (western as well as local). The hotel has a gym but you have to pay around US$20. As with most Japanese hotels, they are not flexible on check in time. Wifi is excellent. Breakfast is rather expensive. English TV is limited to CNN and maybe one other depending on the time of day.Bed is hard, typical of japanese hotels. In room complimentary drink is limited to hot Japanese tea. Staff very friendly. Room is very clean, bed sheet and pillow case fresh, towel smells fresh.

The room was small but clean - which was exactly what we had expected for Tokyo. The view of the city wasn't bad either. And the toilet was awesome, LOL - I can definitely see what all the fuss about Japanese toilets is about. We showered and went to bed, thoroughly exhausted.The breakfast buffet featured a mix of Western and Japanese food, so we loaded up on scrambled eggs, pancakes, and french toast.

great views and rooms were very clean and comfortable. The staff were very helpful and tried to assist where they could. I go t the feeling this hotel was more geared to Japanese business travelers rather than international tourists but regardless, we had a very enjoyable three nights here. There is a very large and well stocked supermarket on ground level with a number of well priced eateries. My only gripe was the walk to the station and no afternoon shuttle so coming back from a long day of sightseeing we had to trek back to the hotel that seems such a short distance in the morning but couldn't be further away at night.

The location of this hotel is quite far from the subway station and my mother and I were disappointed to find that the nearest department store was 20min away by taxi. However, when you go down to the first floor and walk out of the hotel, you will immediately find a Burger King, 100 Yen store, supermarket, an Italian restaurant that opens till 11pm and a sushi restaurant that opens till 1 am. Furthermore, if you want to get to Disney, you must reserve a spot on their shuttle bus. But the spots on the shuttle bus aren't guaranteed so taking a taxi to Disney from the hotel will cost about 4000 yen. Another plus side is that the Airport Limousine from Narita and Haneda both go to Okura for only a small fee for the fare (approx. 900 yen if I remember correctly)

Stayed here for 6 nights attending a World Congress. A business hotel with easy access to the Toyocho station on the Tozai line. Hotel also has an hourly shuttle that drops you at the station. There is an excellent supermarket, a pizza place and other small eateries within a few minutes walk. The rooms were spotless, with all the usual travel amenities. The breakfast buffet was sumptuous. The check in and check out process was super efficient. The hotel is also on the airport limousine route making it very convenient to reach from Narita. The travel desk was not very helpful. The hotel also has a shuttle to the Disney. Hotel also provided umbrellas for an unexpected rainy day. Overall a very pleasant experience

An hour and a half by train from narita airport... Shuttle available but we missed it by a few mins... Next shuttle would have come 4 hrs after so we decided to take the train. Closest station to the hotel was toyocho station, a 10 min walk to the hotel. When we got there the first thing we noticed was that the hotel had a lot restaurants, convenience stores and coffee shops nearby.:) the staff was really pleasant and we were able to check in quickly.. We had a room with a view of the pool which though very nice we weren't able to use as there was far to much to see and experience in Tokyo and we and only 5 days to see as much as we can:) try to request for a room with the view of the Tokyo sky tree which is really beautiful at night:)no matter how far the hotel is from the city center they make up for it by the excellent service, cleanliness of facilities and comfort.

Rooms are pretty small and the distance to get to downtown is a bit far. However, the staff was very friendly and the amenities were nice. There are plenty of convenience stores and small restaurants nearby for eating at any time of day. However, if you want increased convenience, stay closer to the center of the city.

I recomended this place for you if you planning to visit tokyo. This hotel location was strategic because it near with toyocho station which means it can makes your trip easiest. You only take about 10 minutes by walking to the station even though the station still a little bit far if you want to go to shibuya or akihabara .If you need to buy something you can also go to the convinient store which is stay next to this hotel, I think the store name was summit (correct me if I'm wrong), the store was selling a very cheap goods and foods. This hotel also really close with so many restaurant, even burger king also stay next with this hotel. You can also find sushi restaurant around this hotel.The staff was very nice and helpfull. About the breakfast menu they provide two kind of menu; japanese food and western food.The facilities in this hotel was great. I think they already provide everything that we need in a trip :)

English level of hotel staffs are not up to international standard, maybe because I'm just came from Singapore where everyone speaks perfectly, but at least they tried the best with body language and smile all the time.Breakfast was quite decent a combination of local and western food, coffee was average and milk served when it's cold. No senior person around and come to have a chat.I'm easy going person don't like to complain but I will make sure not coming back next time to Tokyo

About 5-8minutes walk from the Toyocho station. The Limousine Bus from Narita International Airport stops here ,also the hotel has its own limousine bus to-from station. Clean,nice outdoor pool,quite close (5min) to Kiba Park.

This hotel is very clean and the staff are great. The breakfast buffet contains both Japanese and Western items. There is a store under the hotel for snacks and also Subway Sandwiches and Burger King. Getting to the hotel from airport takes a little planning. The limo bus only has two busses a day to this location which is a location called CAT and then taxi ride to hotel. If you are more adventurous you can also take train from airport to tokyo station. Then walk to Otemachi station( all underground). At Otemachi station take Toi line to Tokyocho station. The hotel is an 10 minute walk.

Rooms are very spacious and clean; personal is outstandingly friendly and willing to take care of any problems, which do occur; we had not enjoyed any food there, but using the pools (indoor & outdoor) is incredibly expensive (around 4.000 yen per entry); location is quite good: 7min walk to the subway station Toyocho and from there approx 30min to city center

I primarily booked this hotel for the great price i got and it was very close to my office, i decided to take the chance for a nights stay on my return from Osaka. i have to admit i was quite happy with the value and service i got here. i've stayed in many hotels and this hotel does not make the claim to be pretentious.. it is not a top notch hotel but makes me feel like a top notch customer and i value that.Rooms/Bathrooms: absolutely spotlessly clean and well maintained. Bathrooms have all the usual immaculate Japanese fittings that i have grown to like so much... the bathroom has a well stocked bar(for the lack of a better word).. (the best i have seen in my decades of travelling) with pink and white hair bands as well as hair clips for the ladies.. now if only my wife was travelling with me in this trip i know she would have been delighted to see it as she often keeps forgetting her hair accessories.Rooms: relatively spacious.. bit dated like most tokyo hotels i've stayed in, but reasonably spacious.. if you want a WiFi Connection the front desk will provide you with your own Router (returnable at the end of stay) Location: for me close to my office so i am happy.. plenty of taxi's around.. train station is a 5 min walk.. located in the east part of the city i guess its good for those who want to go to Disneyland... beds are nice and comfortable...TIP: try to get the rooms facing the tokyo TV tower.. its a beautiful view at night!!

Rooms are pretty spacious for Tokyo, but... East 21 boasts a beautiful outdoor swimming pool. On June 15, 30°C, they told me it's closed because it's not summer yet (only August, they say). I see it from my room, there's a wedding party there (see photo), which they earn a lot from, I guess. They tell me there's an indoor pool open, I go there ready to swim and they ask me 4,200 Y (42 US$!) to enter. Same for the gym.Breakfast is 22 to 30 US$!Location also not good. To any place in central Tokyo, it's 40 to 90 min., 1 to 3 changes through the metro lines. 1h 15' min. to Shinagawa station to catch a train for other cities.I suggest the Shinagawa Prince instead, which was fully booked this time, but I staid there before: quick metro to anywhere, pool and tea are for free. At East 21 they even charge you 200 yen (2 US$) if you use the single tea bag provided to make yourself a tea. Only hotel in Asia (I've been in 14 this trip, all with with free pool, gym, tea, water) where they don't give you even a bottle of water free.

My wife and I traveled to Tokyo as members of a conducted group tour. Our hotel was changed at the last hour as we reached Tokyo and members of the group were justifiably upset until they checked in at East 21. In the end almost everyone was happy to be in this hotel. The hotel is great and rooms very comfortable. We had a great view of the Tokyo Sky tree at night. The breakfast laid down at the ground floor restaurant had wide and quality selection. Great ambience. Staff in the restaurant was courteous and helpful too. Very pleasant experience overall. Needless to say that like other Japanese hotels we stayed in this hotel too had elegant, and very clean bathroom. Great smelling freshly washed towels and well stocked toiletry. We were very happy to be in this hotel.

Tokyo Subway in a walk distance (10min) Subway,Burguer King, Lawson, Family Mart, Saizerya, Steak House in the 1F and B1F. Free parking.Close to Odaiba, Skytree and Disney.Clean Room,good service.Perfect place to stay in tokyo.

Got a double room here for $105 on Travelocity and was very impressed by the quality and size of the room. The hotel itself is pretty well kept up and quite nice.FYI, they have a shuttle from the Toyocho metro station, so you can save yourself a walk if you time it right. Also, the airport shuttle bus stops here, so you don't need to go catch the train from Tokyo Station.

It's spacious by Japanese standards. A good breakfast spread. Located at a beautiful and quiet area slightly away from the busy Ginza area. A Metro station about 8 mins walk allows us to travel conveniently to other parts of Tokyo. Best part for me is the supermarkets right next to the hotel. Convenient for a late night snack. The annex also has several eateries - a burger king and subway outlets, a western restaurant, a sushi bar and several small n medium sized japanese restaurants. There is also a Middle Eastern restaurant about 10 mins walk left to the hotel where you can get other Asian staples such fried rice and Indian cuisine.

Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in January and was really impressed by this hotel service and it's great location. The room is spacious and clean and the room I had has a good view of the ferris wheel (a bit far though) and the morning sun rise is so beautiful. There are free Lan service in the room (not wireless), but you can loan a router from the front office and instruction for setting up is available in English. With this router, you can convert your room to wireless. Please be noted there are no safe in the room, but they have a safe keeping available in the front office.Daily breakfast is a buffet style of Western and Japanese breakfast. Though most of the dishes remains the same with a bit of changes throughout my 5 days of stay, but the food is good. You must definitely try their 5 Grains Porridge which is so well done. The staffs in the restaurant is very friendly, especially the cook at the egg counter. I remembered asking him for Onsen Tamago (Spa cooked egg) one of the morning which is not available, he remembered me and when I go down for my breakfast the next day, he stopped me and passed me an Onsen Tamago which he specially kept aside for me. I was really impressed by his service. There are quite a few restaurants available just outside the hotel. There's a super market there too which is very convenient. The Metro service is just 7-8 mins walk away from the hotel and along the way there are many shops and fast food available too. With the Metro service, you can travel to the city easily.This is really a nice hotel and I would love to go back again.

I've stayed in this hotel twice in the past couple years. The rooms are very clean, comfortably furnished (good beds), and relatively large by Japanese standards. The staff are pleasant and efficient, and generally good at English. There is a large outdoor pool, a good sized indoor pool and a well-equipped gym in the fitness center, but there is a rather high fee for using these facilities (4,200 yen for hotel guests). A wide variety of both Japanese and western food is available on the breakfast buffet. It is about 10 minutes from central Tokyo by subway and there is a station about 8 minutes walk from the hotel.

Travelled to the hotel for a business meeting in February. The hotel is located in Toyo-Cha about a 7 or 8 minute walk to the Metro station.When you walk in the hotel lobby is nice enough with a big bar in the front and the desk at the back wall. Check in went well. You need to ask for internet access at this point as they will have someone bring up a modem to hook up in your room. This is the cheapest internet that I have ever paid for. It was somewhere around $3 a day which is less than a quarter of what it usually is in North America.As with many Asian hotels the rooms are quite small as is all the things within it. The bed is a small single that was long enough for my 6' frame. The like extremely firm beds in Asia and this was no exception. No such concept of pillow top or Heavenly bed here. Luckily I like firm beds so I had no issue.The work desk is also very small which makes it hard to lay things out. I had my laptop on it and combined with the modem they provide it doesn't leave a lot of room. The internet connection was one of the best I've ever used. Latency and delays were non-existent. I used my soft phone capability on my laptop to phone back through my company phone system and the people on the other end thought I sounded like I was next door and the delay was not noticable.The washroom was small but still had enough room to move around. As with many Japanese toilets this one had a heated seat and a bidet function. I personally don't like warm toilet seats as it leaves a very negative connotation in my head so I looked to find out how to turn that portion off. In order to do so you have to lift up a flap on the back right of the controls that are on your right. Just be careful not to turn on the bidet!There are multiple restaurants and bars in the hotel. Nothing is cheap as you would expect in Tokyo. The restaurant in the lobby the left of the check in is where they had a good buffet for breakfast each morning with North American and Japanese items. All were excellent quality so we had breakfast there each day.We also saw the bar on the top floor but drinks are expensive as you are paying for the ambience and not the drink really. We also tried the top floor Japanese restaurant for lunch. We had a traditional Japanese bent lunch and it was quite good except for a few things I wasn't really sure what they were. Also quite expensive.The TCAT bus which brings you to and from the airport picks up directly from this hotel and you can pick up tickets downstairs. It appears this hotel is the last stop so you go directly from the hotel to the airport on this bus. Very convenient compared to coming in from the airport using the TCAT which brings you to the station and you have to take a 10 minute cab ride to the hotel.All in all it is a good hotel. Only problem you will find here and most places in Tokyo is the porportion of people who smoke is very high compared to North America but like I said, it is not isolated to this hotel.
